Turned out delicious!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Natalie Schwartz"}, "datePublished": "2025-05-15"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "reviewBody": "This recipe is a bit of a mash up between Butter Chicken and Chicken Tikka Masala--using the chicken tikka masala type marinade, but not grilling the chicken or cooking in a tandoor (I don't have one, either). I've not marinated the chicken for butter chicken before, just seasoned it and sauteed it in about 4 T butter prior to adding it to a longer cooking sauce. Traditionally, there is no smoky tandoor flavor in Butter Chicken, as the chicken is merely seasoned and sauteed, so I skipped the smoked paprika and used sweet instead. The sauces for the 2 dishes are similar, and this version is delicious, although I like to use more onion and cook the sauce long enough for the onion to totally dissolve--at least 1.5 hours. I also like a bit more heavy cream, probably 1/2 c., although Indian cooks often use even more. It's really hard to make Indian curries low fat and not sacrifice flavor. Traditionally, Butter Chicken uses a bit more butter, while Chicken Tikka Masala uses none.\r\n\r\nThis recipe, as is, is fast to make, mild in flavor, and not as high fat as traditional curry. It's quite delicious. I jumped right on it and we enjoyed it for lunch today.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2025-05-06"}], "recipeCategory": ["Main Course"], "recipeCuisine": The chicken cooks quickly and always stays tender and juicy!", "datePublished": "2019-07-28T15:57:22+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Baked-Pizza-Chicken-close.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Baked-Pizza-Chicken-close-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Baked-Pizza-Chicken-close-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Baked-Pizza-Chicken-close-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Baked Pizza Chicken", "description": "This easy Baked Pizza Chicken is the perfect fast and easy weeknight dinner. The chicken cooks quickly and always stays tender and juicy! FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/baked-pizza-chicken/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 1 Tbsp Italian seasoning blend \n1/8 tsp garlic powder \n1/8 tsp salt \n2 Tbsp olive oil\n2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 2/3 lb. each) \n1/4 cup pizza sauce \n4 oz. fresh mozzarella \n8 slices pepperoni \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. In a small bowl, stir together the Italian seasoning blend, garlic powder, salt, and olive oil.\n2. Place the chicken breasts on a cutting board and cover with a piece of plastic wrap to prevent splatter. Use a mallet or rolling pin to pound the chicken to an even thickness, about 3/4-inch thick. Cut each chicken breast in half to make two equal sized pieces.\n3. Place the chicken breasts in a shallow baking dish or on a baking sheet, making sure they have at least an inch of space around them. Spread the oil and herb mixture over the surface of each piece of chicken.\n4. Bake the chicken in the fully preheated 400\u00baF oven for 15 minutes. While the chicken in baking, slice the mozzarella.\n5. After 15 minutes, remove the chicken from the oven. Spread 1 Tbsp pizza sauce over the surface of each piece. Next top each piece with about 1oz. mozzarella and two slices of pepperoni.\n6. Return the chicken to the oven and bake for 5-7 minutes more, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165\u00baF. Remove from the oven and serve.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-08-31T20:03:21+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/jRDAcgfjB5Y/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/jRDAcgfjB5Y?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jRDAcgfjB5Y", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 Tbsp Italian seasoning blend ($0.30)", "1/8 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)", "2 Tbsp  olive oil ($0.32)", "2  boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 2/3 lb. each) ($7.64)", "1/4 cup pizza sauce ($0.17)", "4 oz. fresh mozzarella ($1.33)", "8 slices pepperoni ($0.23)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Set these ingredients to the side.", "name": "Prep the ingredients", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/strawberry-spinach-salad/#wprm-recipe-82858-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the spinach between four plates. Feel free to drizzle a little more balsamic vinaigrette over the top of each and enjoy!", "name": "Serve", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/strawberry-spinach-salad/#wprm-recipe-82858-step-0-6"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.91", "ratingCount": "10", "reviewCount": "10"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "My family has loved this recipe for years! I always get nuts on sale during the winter holiday season when Aldi's has really good buys. I make plenty of glazed pecans, but since they never last the year, I have some of my Christmas priced pecans in the freezer just for summer salads! While this balsamic vinaigrette is a fave, I also make an almost identical dressing with very inexpensive apple cider vinegar, less sweetener, and a neutral oil. Strawberries have been particularly plentiful, inexpensive, and yummy this summer, so we've been eating lots in a variety of ways. This salad would also work with watermelon. Although I'm a giant Feta cheese fan, I can recommend inexpensive Queso Fresco from Aldi's as a sub--similar crumbly texture and salty taste. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Roasted Cauliflower Salad with Lemon Tahini Dressing", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "This Roasted Cauliflower Salad combines sweet roasted red onions, spiced chickpeas, tender cauliflower, and a tangy lemon tahini dressing.", "datePublished": "2017-02-01T14:25:39+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Roasted-Cauliflower-Salad-close.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Roasted-Cauliflower-Salad-close-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Roasted-Cauliflower-Salad-close-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Roasted-Cauliflower-Salad-close-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Roasted Cauliflower Salad", "description": "This roasted cauliflower salad is full of flavor and texture, and makes a great prep-ahead meal for the week!  FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2017/02/roasted-cauliflower-salad-lemon-tahini-dressing/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 head cauliflower \n1/2 red onion \n2 Tbsp olive oil\nSalt and Pepper to taste \n1/2 bunch parsley\nLEMON TAHINI DRESSING\n1/3 cup tahini \n1/3 cup water \n1/4 cup lemon juice \n2 cloves garlic, minced \n1/2 tsp cumin \n1/4 tsp cayenne \n1/4 tsp salt \nSPICED CHICKPEAS\n15 oz can chickpeas \n1 Tbsp olive oil\n1/2 tsp smoked paprika \n1/4 tsp garlic powder \n1/8 tsp cayenne \nSalt and Pepper to taste \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Chop the cauliflower into small florets and place them on a large baking sheet. Slice the red onion into 1/4-inch strips and place them on the baking sheet. Drizzle the cauliflower and onions with olive oil and season with a pinch or two of salt and pepper. Toss the cauliflower and onions until coated in oil, salt, and pepper.\n2. Roast the cauliflower and onions in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, then stir, return them to the oven, and roast for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and browned on the edges. Let the cauliflower cool slightly.\n3. While the cauliflower and onions are roasting, make the lemon tahini dressing. Add the tahini, water, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, cayenne, and salt to a blender. Blend until smooth, then refrigerate until ready to serve.\n4. Drain and rinse the can of chickpeas. Add them to a skillet along with the olive oil, smoked paprika, cayenne, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir and cook the chickpeas over medium heat for about five minutes, or until they sizzle and become slightly crispy. Remove the chickpeas from the heat.\n5. Pull the parsley leaves from their stems and roughly chop the leaves into small pieces (about 1.5 cups loosely packed, once chopped).\n6. To build the salad, combine the roasted cauliflower and onions in a bowl with the spiced chickpeas and chopped parsley. Drizzle the lemon tahini dressing over top, and toss to combine. Serve warm or cold.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-01-07T17:25:13+00:00", "duration": "PT1M27S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/2m2puuD0GLA/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/2m2puuD0GLA?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2m2puuD0GLA", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT35M", "totalTime": "PT50M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  head cauliflower ($3.12)", "1/2  red onion ($0.94)", "2 Tbsp olive oil ($0.22)", "Salt and Pepper to taste ($0.05)", "1/2 bunch parsley* ($0.45)", "1/3 cup tahini ($2.04)", "1/3 cup water ($0.00)", "1/4 cup lemon juice** ($0.18)", "2 cloves garlic, minced ($0.08)", "1/2 tsp cumin ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp cayenne ($0.03)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1 15oz. can chickpeas ($0.94)", "1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.22)", "1/2 tsp smoked paprika ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.03)", "1/8 tsp cayenne ($0.02)", "Salt and Pepper to taste ($0.05)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/pizzadillas/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 6 10-inch flour tortillas \n2 cups shredded mozzarella \n30 pepperoni slices\n1 bell pepper \n1/2 red onion \n2.25oz can sliced black olives\n1 can mushrooms\n1/2 batch Thick & Rich Pizza Sauce \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Prep the ingredients by thinly slicing the vegetables and draining the olives and mushrooms.\n2. For each pizzadilla: Measure 1/3 cup of shredded cheese. Sprinkle half of the cheese over one half of the tortilla, add toppings and then sprinkle the rest of the cheese on top. Fold the empty side of the tortilla over the toppings.\n3. Place the pizzadilla in a prewarmed skillet (medium heat) and cook until brown and crispy on the bottom. Carefully flip the pizzadilla over and cook until brown and crispy on the second side. Once both sides are crisp and the cheese is melted inside, slice into thirds with a pizza cutter. Dip in the pizza sauce prior to eating.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-06-29T22:50:31+00:00", "duration": "PT1M2S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8azEr6liBhs/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/8azEr6liBhs?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8azEr6liBhs", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  green bell pepper ($0.99)", "\u00bd  red onion ($0.45)", "2.25 oz. can sliced black olives ($1.77)", "4 oz. can mushrooms ($1.58)", "30 slices pepperoni ($0.94)", "6  flour tortillas (10-inch, $1.18)", "2 cups mozzarella cheese (shredded, $1.78)", "1\u00bd cups pizza sauce ($1.70*)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prep the ingredients by thinly slicing the vegetables and draining the olives and mushrooms.", "name": "Prep", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pizzadillas/#wprm-recipe-30152-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For each pizzadilla: Measure 1/3 cup of shredded cheese. Dip in the pizza sauce prior to eating.", "name": "Serve", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pizzadillas/#wprm-recipe-30152-step-0-3"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.82", "ratingCount": "16", "reviewCount": "11"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "We do something similar at our bar. The toppings are saut\u00e9ed in a fry pan on the side, veggies first with a touch of olive oil, then pepperoni and sausage to bring the oils out. It just makes it easier cooking them in an 8\" fry pan rather than on the grill, although doing it all on the griddle is fine too. Then squirt a little Whirl liquid butter on the grill and take a 12\" flour tortilla and swirl it around so the underside is coated. Then add the mozz to both sides, and the other toppings from the fry pan on half. When the cheese is melted, it's usually browned enough. We fold it over, take it off the grill, and dust with grated Parmesan. We then cut it, and place the pieces (dusted side down) in a basket, and dust the top. There is something amazing about the texture and flavor of adding the butter substitute and the Parmesan. It's just not the same without it. And yes, we use a nice marinara dipping sauce (Pro tip: We use Dei Fratellli Italian Sauce. Great if you can find it.) and brings it all together. Many of our customers call it a pizza\"dill\"a. It always cracks me up. It's been a strong seller for 12 years now.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "TCRider"}, "datePublished": "2023-03-11"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "love this recipe  For an easy way to cook them try using a flat sandwich press. While the press is heating make your pizzadillas and when press is hot place on base and close lid and it cooks both sides at the same time. (saves time and easy clean up) For an extra hit of cheesy flavour try putting a little grated parm cheese on base just before you place your pizzadillas in and also a little on top of it as well before you close the lid you will know when it is done when you lift the lid slightly and the parm cheese is melted and set to the tortilla and released from the lid Yummm this works well with toasted wraps also. If you have a big enough sandwich press you can put the whole tortilla on with filling and top with another. The original recipe doesn\u2019t include CILANTRO or CUMIN but it includes finely chopped white onions.\r\nThe name of the sauce probably comes from Basque tximitxurri, (approximately chee-mee-CHOO-ree), loosely translated as \"a mixture of several things in no particular order\".\r\nChimichurri is basically made from finely chopped parsley, minced garlic and onion, olive (or corn or sunflower) oil, oregano, red pepper flakes, and apple cider vinegar or red wine vinegar.In its red version (probably the most known here in Argentina) minced tomato and red bell pepper may also be added.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Alexa"}, "datePublished": "2018-03-26"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Seriously the best sauce EVER!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Stephanie Stallsmith"}, "datePublished": "2016-12-30"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Holy cow! Add olive oil and onion to a large deep skillet over medium heat and saut\u00e9 until onions are translucent, approximately 2-3 minutes. Add minced garlic and saut\u00e9 an additional 30 seconds or until garlic is fragrant.", "name": "Dice the red onion and mince the garlic. Once boiling, immediately reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes. This will allow the lentils to start cooking first before adding the rice.", "name": "Next add in the lentils, black beans, fire roasted tomatoes (with juices), corn, and vegetable broth. It is seriously pricey in my local supermarkets, and if you know of a Middle Eastern grocery, you can get real buys there--my most fave being the mildly flavored Bulgarian goat feta. But back to the warehouse stores--a big block of several pounds usually costs under $10, and you can keep it a really long time--several months, in my fridge--if you make sure it is covered with water and change that water every 3-5 days. When I buy tht much, though, I usually share some of it with my DIL. A bit of upkeep for sure, but you will find lots of ways to use it beyond salads. I like to sprinkle some crumbled bits on pizza, and it is a great sub for Mexican white cheeses on tacos and enchiladas. Mince the garlic, grate the ginger, dice the carrot and bell pepper, slice the green onions (separate the green ends from the white ends), and measure the frozen peas.", "name": "Prepare", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a separate, clean cutting board, cut your chicken into \u00bd inch pieces so you get a little in every bite. Set aside (and wash your hands!)", "name": "Cut", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly whisk the eggs in a small bowl. Transfer the cooked eggs to a clean bowl or plate off to the side.", "name": "Scramble", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the heat up to medium-high. Add the diced carrots, stir, and cook for about two minutes. Next, add the bell pepper and the white firm ends of the green onions. Cook and stir for one minute more. Finally, add the frozen peas and stir and cook until heated through. Transfer the vegetables to a clean bowl or plate.", "name": "Cook", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining 1 Tbsp cooking oil to the skillet and swirl to coat the surface. Add the \u00bd inch pieces of chicken and completely cook through, about 4 minutes. Once the chicken is about \u00bd of the way cooked through (2-3 minutes), add the garlic and ginger and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.", "name": "Cook", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Then, add the cooked and cooled rice to the skillet. Stir and cook the chicken and rice together for about 2 minutes, or until the rice is heated through. Pour the soy sauce and toasted sesame oil over the rice. Stir the rice and sauce together until evenly combined. Turn the heat off.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the eggs and vegetables back to the skillet with the chicken and rice and stir to combine. Taste and adjust the soy sauce or sesame oil to your liking.", "name": "Add", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-fried-rice/#wprm-recipe-91473-step-0-6"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.15", "ratingCount": "7", "reviewCount": "7"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "reviewBody": "As someone who grew up on Chicken Helper chicken fried rice, I so wanted to love this recipe. But, I just didn't. As Tina mentioned, the sesame oil was bizarre- think slightly burnt tasting sesame rice with hints of a few other flavors (garlic, ginger, soy umami). I appreciate that it includes a lot of vegetables, though I wish there had been a note in the steps that they shouldn't all be put in one bowl upon dicing. Still, I won't take any stars away for that or for how many dishes this requires as those things could be reduced to user error not reading the recipe through right before making it. I would hope that this could turn out better using an actual wok, as a cast iron skillet does not appear to work well. I meal prepped this for next week, and will try to make myself eat it with a lot of Kikkoman teriyaki and hot sauce added to it so that I don't waste too much of it, but I will not make this recipe again.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "R K"}, "datePublished": "2025-09-13"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Another wonderful recipe! The marinade was amazing! Didn't have cloves, so substituted a pinch of garam masala.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Christine"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-28"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Cinnamon and, less often, nutmeg are used in very small quantities in many Middle Eastern meat recipes. I spent years in Saudi Arabia, and can attest that the flavors of this recipe are quite similar to the delicious shwarmas we bought weekly from street vendors. The garlic sauce is sort of a tzatziki minus cucumbers, so no reason not to use cucumber in these sandwiches. Those SA wraps were very simple--seasoned beef, lamb, or chicken cooked on a vertical rotisserie; garlic sauce; and--believe it or not--strips of dill pickle, and sliced red onion. Lebanese shwarmas use pickled turnips instead of the dill pix, and those are really crunchy and delicious. I think the shwarmas we ate those many years ago used sumac or a spice mix with za'atar instead of lemon for the tart flavor. Za'atar is related to oregano--I only remember it used in conjunction with sumac, garlic, and a few other spices.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-09"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "I used chicken thighs and cooked in my cast iron because no grill and it was perfect. While the water is heating, remove the stem from the cauliflower and cut it into florets. Once the water begins to boil, add the cauliflower and continue to the boil it for about 10 minutes, or until it is very tender.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/beef-ragout-with-mashed-cauliflower/#wprm-recipe-32348-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Save about 1/2 cup of the cauliflower cooking water, and then drain the rest in a colander. Return the drained cauliflower to the pot with the heat turned off. Add the butter, chicken base, and one clove of minced garlic. Mash the cauliflower using a potato masher or an immersion blender, adding back some of the reserved cooking water if the moisture becomes dry. Season with salt and pepper to taste.", "name": "Save about 1/2 cup of the cauliflower cooking water, and then drain the rest in a colander. Return the drained cauliflower to the pot with the heat turned off. Add the butter, chicken base, and one clove of minced garlic. Mash the cauliflower using a potato masher or an immersion blender, adding back some of the reserved cooking water if the moisture becomes dry. Season with salt and pepper to taste.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/beef-ragout-with-mashed-cauliflower/#wprm-recipe-32348-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the ragout, dice the onion and mince the garlic. Using the large holes on a box grater (or food processor with a hole blade attachment), grate the zucchini, onion, jalapeno, and red bell pepper on the parchment. Transfer each vegetable into a colander after you grate it.", "name": "Grate the veggies", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the vegetables with salt and set the colander on a plate or in a bowl to drain for 30 minutes. Squeeze out the excess water.", "name": "Brine the veggies", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 30 minutes, add the apple cider vinegar, sugar, turmeric, pepper, and bay leaf into a medium pot. Bring to a boil and add the grated vegetables. Simmer the vegetables for 15 minutes, then let them cool for 15 minutes off the heat.", "name": "Simmer", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Clean and sterilize your canning jars.** Remove the bay leaf from the pot. Ladle in the zucchini relish with liquid, leaving \u00bc to \u00bd inch from the top. Use a butter knife or chopsticks to remove any air bubbles. Wipe down the jars and screw on the lids.", "name": "Can", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place a rack in the bottom of the large pot. If you do not have one, you can use extra jar lids or a tea towel. Fill the pot halfway with water and bring it to a boil.", "name": "Boil", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully lower the jars into the water using oven mitts or tongs. They should be about 1 inch apart. There should also be at least \u00bd-inch to 1-inch of water covering the jars. Add more water if needed.", "name": "Cover", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the water to a full boil, cover the pot, and let it cook for 30 minutes. Keep the water on a full boil during the entire cooking process.", "name": "Cook", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a jar lifter or tongs (you can wrap rubber bands around the tongs for a better grip on the jars), carefully lift out the jars and place them on a towel.", "name": "Remove the jars", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the jarred zucchini relish cool thoroughly for 12-24 hours at room temperature.*** Check to make sure that the lid is sealed fully. If it does not, you can reprocess the jars, use them first, or refrigerate them right away. Label and date the jars and store them in a cool, dark place for a year.", "name": "Cool", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-relish/#wprm-recipe-132818-step-0-9"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "5", "ratingCount": "1", "reviewCount": "1"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Turned out great! will make this again. Once it reaches a full boil, turn the heat down to low and let the rice simmer for 15 minutes without lifting the lid. After 15 minutes, turn the heat off and let the rice rest for 5 minutes without lifting the lid. Finally, fluff the rice with a fork and divide it between four bowls or containers.", "name": "While the cauliflower is roasting, begin cooking the rice. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/honey-mustard-broccoli-salad/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n\nHONEY MUSTARD DRESSING\n1/2 cup mayonnaise \n1 Tbsp Dijon mustard \n1 Tbsp yellow mustard \n3 Tbsp honey \n1 tsp apple cider vinegar \n1/8 tsp garlic powder \n1/8 tsp paprika \n1/8 tsp salt \nfreshly cracked pepper \n\nSALAD\n1 large crown Broccoli (about 5 cups chopped)\n1/4 red onion (about 1/2 cup diced) \n1/3 cup slivered almonds\n1/4 cup dried cranberries \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Prepare the honey mustard dressing by stirring together the mayonnaise, Dijon, yellow mustard, honey, vinegar, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and some freshly cracked pepper. Set the dressing aside.\n2. Chop the broccoli into small pieces. Finely dice the red onion.\n3. Combine the broccoli, onion, almonds, and dried cranberries in a large bowl. Add about half of the honey mustard dressing and stir to coat. Add more dressing to your liking (I used about 3/4 of the batch).\n4. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-09-19T21:43:58+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BWE3Ln4i1fo/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/BWE3Ln4i1fo?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BWE3Ln4i1fo", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["5", "5 1 cup each"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT15M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup mayonnaise ($0.80)", "1 Tbsp Dijon mustard ($0.09)", "1 Tbsp yellow mustard ($0.09)", "3 Tbsp honey ($0.36)", "1 tsp apple cider vinegar ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp paprika ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.02)", "freshly cracked pepper ($0.02)", "1 large crown Broccoli (about 5 cups chopped) ($1.69)", "1/4  red onion (about 1/2 cup diced) ($0.11)", "1/3 cup slivered almonds ($0.64)", "1/4 cup dried cranberries ($0.22)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the honey mustard dressing by stirring together the mayonnaise, Dijon, yellow mustard, honey, vinegar, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and some freshly cracked pepper. These enchiladas are extra creamy and full of flavor! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/cheese-enchiladas/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n12 small corn tortillas ($0.80)\n12 oz. cheese, shredded ($3.44)\n1 4oz. can diced green chiles (drained) ($0.89)\n1/4 cup sour cream ($0.19)\n1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp ground cumin ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)\n1.5 cups enchilada sauce ($0.60)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Toast the tortillas in a hot skillet, one at a time for a few seconds on each side, or just until lightly browned.\n2. Add \u00be of the shredded cheese to a bowl (saving the remainder to top the enchiladas). Also add the drained green chiles, sour cream, garlic powder, cumin, and salt. Stir the ingredients to combine.\n3. Preheat the oven to 350\u00baF. Add about \u00bd cup of enchilada sauce to the bottom of a large casserole dish and spread it around until it covers the surface.\n4. Fill each tortilla with about 3 Tbsp of the cheese filling, then roll to close, and place them in the casserole dish. Continue until all of the tortillas have been filled, rolled, and placed in the dish.\n5. Pour the remaining 1 cup of enchilada sauce over the enchiladas, then top with the remaining shredded cheese.\n6. Bake the enchiladas for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or just until they are heated through and melty. Do not overbake the enchiladas, as this can cause the filling to separate and curdle. Serve hot with your favorite toppings* and sides!\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIME STAMPS \n0:00 Introduction\n0:06 Make Cheese Filling\n0:016 Layer in Enchilada Sauce\n0:19 Fill and Roll Tortillas\n0:26 Cover with Enchilada Sauce\n0:28 Top with Cheese\n0:30 Bake\n0:33 Serve and Enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2022-08-28T14:47:48+00:00", "duration": "PT44S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RsIjl32hvpY/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/RsIjl32hvpY?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RsIjl32hvpY", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 3 enchiladas each"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeIngredient": ["12 small corn tortillas ($0.80)", "12 oz. cheese, shredded ($3.44)", "1 4oz. can diced green chiles (drained) ($0.89)", "1/4 cup sour cream ($0.19)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp ground cumin ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)", "1.5 cups enchilada sauce ($0.60)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the tortillas in a hot skillet, one at a time for a few seconds on each side, or just until lightly browned.", "name": "Toast the tortillas in a hot skillet, one at a time for a few seconds on each side, or just until lightly browned.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/cheese-enchiladas/#wprm-recipe-64282-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add \u00be of the shredded cheese to a bowl (saving the remainder to top the enchiladas). The perfect side dish for any summer meal.  FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/lemony-cucumber-couscous-salad/\n Full Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 1 1/2 to 2 cups Israeli couscous\n2 medium cucumbers \n1/4 bunch parsley \n1 medium lemon\n2 Tbsp olive oil \n1/4 tsp garlic powder \n1/4 tsp salt \nfreshly cracked pepper to taste \n3 oz. crumbled feta cheese\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Bring a medium pot of water to a rolling boil. Add the couscous and continue to let it boil for 5-7 minutes, or until the couscous is tender. Drain the couscous in a colander or wire mesh sieve (if the holes in the colander are too big). Rinse briefly with cool water to cool off the couscous, then allow to drain while you prepare the rest of the salad.\n2. Cut the cucumber into quarter rounds and place them in a large bowl. Take a big handful (or about 1/4 bunch) of parsley and pull the leaves from the stems. Roughly chop the parsley and then add it to the bowl with the cucumber. Use a fine holed cheese grater or a zester to remove the thin layer of yellow zest from the lemon and add it the bowl with the other ingredients.\n3. Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the juice into a small bowl (you should get 2-3 tablespoons of juice). Add the olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and some freshly cracked pepper. Stir to combine and then pour the dressing over the cucumber, parsley, and lemon zest. Stir to combine.\n4. Add the cooled and drained couscous and crumbled feta to the bowl. Gently stir to combine all of the ingredients. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper as needed. Serve immediately or chill until ready to eat.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-06-16T20:33:14+00:00", "duration": "PT50S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/y67K3DR-m8o/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/y67K3DR-m8o?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y67K3DR-m8o", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 1 cup each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["1.5 cups pearl couscous  ($2.20)", "1  fresh lemon  ($0.89)", "2 Tbsp olive oil  ($0.32)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder  ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp salt  ($0.02)", "1  English cucumber ($1.49)", "1/2 cup parsley  ($0.27)", "1/4 tsp freshly cracked pepper ($0.02)", "3 oz. feta cheese, crumbled  ($1.23)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a pot of water to a boil. Stir until they are very well combined.", "name": "Mix", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grate the butter into the flour mixture and stir until the butter is well incorporated and no large lumps remain.", "name": "Stir", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the chocolate chunks to the flour mixture and stir to combine.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk together the sourdough discard, milk, eggs, and vanilla extract in a separate bowl.", "name": "Whisk", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the wet discard mixture into the bowl with the flour mixture and chocolate chunks. Stir everything together until it forms a cohesive ball of dough, with no dry flour remaining on the bottom of the bowl. If the dough is too dry to come together into a single ball of dough, add a splash more milk (1 Tbsp or so) until it comes together.", "name": "Mix", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Form a dough ball at the bottom of your mixing bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Allow your scone dough to proof for 1-3 hours, until your dough ball noticeably grows in size, at least by a quarter the volume, ideally the volume will double. (Yes, this step takes a little extra patience, but the fluffy texture from the sourdough makes these scones a little extra special! You could also bake this right away, they just won\u2019t be as fluffy and will be more like a classic scone.)", "name": "Proof", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sourdough-chocolate-chip-scones/#wprm-recipe-121312-step-0-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Press the dough out into an 8-inch diameter circle on a piece of parchment paper. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/roasted-bratwurst-peppers-onions/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n-2 Tbsp olive oil \n-1 Tbsp red wine vinegar\n-1/2 Tbsp stone ground deli mustard\n-1/4 tsp garlic powder\n-1/8 tsp salt\n-Freshly cracked pepper\n-3 bell peppers (any color)\n-1 onion\n-5 bratwurst links\n-5 buns \n-2 oz. cheddar (optional topping)\n-4 Tbsp mustard (optional topping)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. In a small bowl stir together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, stone ground mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Set the vinaigrette aside.\n\n2. Slice the bell peppers and onion into 1/4-inch strips and place them on a large baking sheet. Add the bratwurst links to the baking sheet, then drizzle the vinaigrette over top. Toss the peppers, onions, and bratwurst until everything is coated in vinaigrette.\n\n3.Place the baking sheet in the oven and roast for 20 minutes, then give everything a good stir. Return the baking sheet to the oven and roast for another 20-25 minutes, or until the bratwurst, peppers, and onions, have browned on the edges.\n\n4. Stuff the bratwurst, peppers, and onions into the buns and top with shredded cheddar if desired. Place them back in the oven for about 5 minutes to melt the cheese and toast the buns. Top with more mustard just before serving.\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-10-19T21:49:50+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/6nAbIyrB8gE/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/6nAbIyrB8gE?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6nAbIyrB8gE", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["5"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 Tbsp olive oil ($0.26)", "1 Tbsp red wine vinegar ($0.10)", "1/2 Tbsp stone ground or whole grain mustard* ($0.03)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)", "Freshly cracked pepper ($0.05)", "3  bell peppers (any color) ($2.57)", "1  onion ($0.28)", "5  bratwurst links ($3.49)", "5  buns ($1.56)", "2 oz. cheddar (optional topping) ($0.50)", "4 Tbsp mustard (optional topping) ($0.24)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Stir very well until the almond butter fully combines with the liquid and the mixture is smooth. Add more water, if needed, to make the dressing smooth and pourable (I used 3 Tbsp total). ($2.53*)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil  ($0.08)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder  ($0.03)", "1/2 tsp ground ginger  ($0.05)", "Salt and Pepper to taste  ($0.05)", "1/4 cup ketchup  ($0.20)", "1/4 cup brown sugar  ($0.16)", "1/3 cup rice or apple cider vinegar ($0.16)", "1.5 Tbsp soy sauce  ($0.14)", "1.5 Tbsp cornstarch  ($0.06)", "3  green onions, sliced ($0.21)", "6 cups cooked rice ($1.13)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Cut the onion, bell peppers, and chicken breasts into one-inch pieces. Drain the pineapple well, reserving the juice for the sauce. Place the onion, bell pepper, chicken, and pineapple chunks on a large sheet pan in a single layer. Use two sheets, if needed, to prevent the chicken and vegetables from piling on top of each other. They need a little room to brown correctly.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Cut the onion, bell peppers, and chicken breasts into one-inch pieces. Drain the pineapple well, reserving the juice for the sauce. Place the onion, bell pepper, chicken, and pineapple chunks on a large sheet pan in a single layer. Use two sheets, if needed, to prevent the chicken and vegetables from piling on top of each other. They need a little room to brown correctly.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sheet-pan-sweet-sour-chicken/#wprm-recipe-30422-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle the cooking oil over the ingredients on the sheet pan, followed by the garlic powder, ground ginger, and a pinch or two of salt and pepper. Stir half way through the baking time to redistribute the heat and allow excess moisture to evaporate.", "name": "Bake the chicken and vegetables in the oven for about 40 minutes, or until they are slightly browned on the edges. In a small sauce pot whisk together the reserved pineapple juice (about 1 cup), ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch until the cornstarch is fully dissolved. Heat the mixture over medium flame, stirring often, until it begins to simmer. When it begins to simmer the cornstarch will begin to gel and thicken the sauce. Once the sauce has thickened to a glaze, remove it from the heat and set it aside until ready to use.", "name": "While the chicken and vegetables are baking, prepare the sauce. In a small sauce pot whisk together the reserved pineapple juice (about 1 cup), ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch until the cornstarch is fully dissolved. Heat the mixture over medium flame, stirring often, until it begins to simmer. When it begins to simmer the cornstarch will begin to gel and thicken the sauce. Once the sauce has thickened to a glaze, remove it from the heat and set it aside until ready to use.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/sheet-pan-sweet-sour-chicken/#wprm-recipe-30422-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the chicken and vegetables have finished baking, remove them from the oven and pour the prepared sauce over top. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-lemon-pepper-chicken/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n2 boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 lbs. total) ($6.79)\n2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)\n1 Tbsp lemon pepper seasoning ($0.30)\n1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)\n1 clove garlic, minced ($0.08)\n1/2 cup chicken broth ($0.07)\n1 Tbsp butter ($0.14)\n1 tsp lemon juice ($0.02)\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)\n1/8 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Use a sharp knife to carefully fillet the chicken breasts into two thinner peices (or use thin-cut chicken breasts).\n2. Combine the flour and lemon pepper seasoning in a bowl. Sprinkle the mixture over both sides of the chicken breast pieces and then rub it in until the chicken is fully coated.\n3. Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium. When the skillet and oil are very hot, add the chicken and cook on each side until golden brown (about 5 minutes per side). Remove the cooked chicken to a clean plate and cover to keep warm.\n4. Add the butter and minced garlic to the skillet and saut\u00e9 for about one minute.\n5. Add the chicken broth to the skillet and whisk to dissolve all the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Add the lemon juice and allow the sauce to simmer in the skillet for 3-5 minutes, or until it has reduced slightly. Taste the sauce and add salt if needed (I did not add any).\n6. Finally, return the chicken to the skillet and spoon the sauce over top. Allow the chicken to heat through. Season with a little freshly cracked pepper and fresh chopped parsley (optional), then serve.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Fillet chicken breasts\n0:13 Combine flour and lemon pepper\n0:17 Coat chicken breasts\n0:22 Cook chicken breasts\n0:32 Remove chicken from skillet\n0:35 Saut\u00e9 garlic in butter\n0:38 Add chicken broth and lemon juice\n0:41 Deglaze pan\n0:43 Return Chicken to pan\n0:48 Top with pepper and parsley\n0:53 Serve and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2021-04-11T18:52:39+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/-g1784BoNno/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/-g1784BoNno?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-g1784BoNno", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["2  boneless skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 lbs. total) ($6.79)", "2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp lemon pepper seasoning ($0.30)", "1 Tbsp  cooking oil ($0.04)", "1 clove garlic, minced ($0.08)", "1/2 cup chicken broth ($0.07)", "1 Tbsp butter ($0.14)", "1 tsp lemon juice ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)", "1/8 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a sharp knife to carefully fillet the chicken breasts into two thinner pieces (or use thin-cut chicken breasts).", "name": "Use a sharp knife to carefully fillet the chicken breasts into two thinner pieces (or use thin-cut chicken breasts).", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-lemon-pepper-chicken/#wprm-recipe-54454-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the flour and lemon pepper seasoning in a bowl. They&#39;re freezer-friendly, too!", "datePublished": "2022-05-28T08:47:01+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Blueberry-Muffins-side.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Blueberry-Muffins-side-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Blueberry-Muffins-side-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/Blueberry-Muffins-side-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Blueberry Muffins", "description": "These homemade blueberry muffins are fluffy and moist with a deliciously crunchy crumble topping. They're freezer-friendly, too! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/homemade-blueberry-muffins/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1.5 cups all-purpose flour ($0.18)\n2 tsp baking powder ($0.04)\n3/4 tsp salt ($0.04)\n1/4 tsp cinnamon ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp nutmeg ($0.02)\n1 cup plain yogurt* ($0.85)\n1/2 cup granulated sugar ($0.08)\n4 Tbsp melted butter ($0.40)\n2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.08)\n1 large egg ($0.21)\n1.5 tsp vanilla extract ($0.42)\n1 cup blueberries ($1.33)\nCrumble Topping (optional)\n1 Tbsp melted butter ($0.10)\n2 Tbsp granulated sugar ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp cinnamon ($0.02)\n2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS \n1. If using the crumble topping, prepare that first. Stir together the melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon, then add in the flour and stir until it resembles damp sand. Set the topping aside.\n2. Preheat the oven to 375\u00baF. Whisk together the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg) in a large bowl until well combined.\n3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, sugar, melted butter, oil, egg, and vanilla extract.\n4. Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl of dry ingredients and stir until they're about 75% combined (there should still be pockets of dry flour throughout).\n5. If using frozen blueberries, dust them with about 1/2 tsp flour first. Add the blueberries to the batter and finish folding until the blueberries are evenly incorporated and there are no more dry pockets of dry flour in the batter. It's okay if it's lumpy, just make sure to avoid over-stirring.\n6. Divide the batter between eight wells of a greased or lined muffin tin. Top the unbaked muffins with the crumble topping.\n7. Bake the muffins for about 35 minutes, or until golden brown on top. Allow the muffins to cool for about 5 minutes in the muffin tin, then loosen the edges with a knife and transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIME STAMPS \n0:00 Introduction\n0:05 Mix together dry ingredients\n0:12 Mix together wet ingredients in a separate bowl\n0:22 Combine all ingredients & mix well \n0:33 Add blueberries & flour mixture to main bowl & stir\n0:37 Pour finished batter into muffin tray\n0:40 Make crumble topping\n0:50 Top muffin batter with crumble topping\n0:52 Bake at 375 degrees for 35 mins\n0:55 Allow to cool. Serve & Enjoy!\n\n#blueberrymuffins #muffinrecipe #muffins #budgetbytes #blueberry", "uploadDate": "2022-10-23T14:00:06+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kdvlIJFrwuA/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/kdvlIJFrwuA?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kdvlIJFrwuA", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8", "8 muffins"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT35M", "totalTime": "PT50M", "recipeIngredient": ["1.5 cups all-purpose flour ($0.18)", "2 tsp baking powder ($0.04)", "3/4 tsp salt ($0.04)", "1/4 tsp cinnamon ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp  nutmeg ($0.02)", "1 cup plain yogurt* ($0.85)", "1/2 cup granulated sugar ($0.08)", "4 Tbsp melted butter ($0.40)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.08)", "1 large egg ($0.21)", "1.5 tsp vanilla extract ($0.42)", "1 cup blueberries  ($1.33)", "1 Tbsp melted butter ($0.10)", "2 Tbsp granulated sugar ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp cinnamon ($0.02)", "2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If using the crumble topping, prepare that first. Stir together the melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon, then add in the flour and stir until it resembles damp sand. Set the topping aside.", "name": "If using the crumble topping, prepare that first. Stir together the melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon, then add in the flour and stir until it resembles damp sand. And this is not an every night desert, but a celebration spectacular. One simply needs to budget one's intake to make room for a slice. This cake produces 12 generous servings. At a recent family celebration--with a different desert--my DIL cut bare slivers for those of us adults who were watching calories. Our slender and active younger family members had no problem running off the calories. A taste can go a long way, and a cake like this, particularly frozen minus frosting, can spend a fair amount of time in the freezer. It\u2019s the perfect fast fix! FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/rice-cooker-mac-and-cheese/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked macaroni noodles \n1 cup vegetable broth \n1/3 cup milk \n2 oz. cream cheese \n3 oz. medium cheddar, shredded\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Add the macaroni and vegetable broth to the rice cooker. Close the lid and cook on the \"steam\" setting for 5 minutes. It may take 5-7 minutes to come up to temperature before it begins counting down the 5 minutes of cook time. Stir the pasta twice during cooking, once when the cook time begins to count down, and again when there is about 2 minutes left. Close the lid promptly after stirring each time.\n2. While the pasta is cooking, cut the cream cheese into chunks. After 5 minutes of cooking, the pasta should have absorbed all of the broth (if not, cook a few minutes longer). Turn the rice cooker to the \"keep warm\" setting, and add the milk and cream cheese. Stir until the cream cheese has melted.\n3. Finally, add half of the shredded cheddar and stir until it has melted, then repeat with the second half. If the cheese sauce becomes too thick or dry for your liking, simply stir in an extra splash of milk. Serve hot.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-10-03T20:52:56+00:00", "duration": "PT59S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XC7G1EZPFqo/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/XC7G1EZPFqo?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XC7G1EZPFqo", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["2"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup uncooked macaroni noodles ($0.17)", "1 cup vegetable broth ($0.13)", "1/3 cup  milk ($0.06)", "2 oz.  cream cheese ($0.50)", "3 oz. medium cheddar, shredded ($0.71)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the macaroni and vegetable broth to the rice cooker. (If you have a small food processor, you can do this step in batches and mix everything together well by hand before spreading.)", "name": "Make the cheese layer", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dab zucchini slices dry with a clean cloth or paper towels. Transfer to parchment-lined baking sheets (I used 2) and lightly mist zucchini with oil and sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake in the oven for 5 minutes to help dehydrate them slightly. (This is an important step if you don\u2019t want extra juicy lasagna!)", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove zucchini from oven and set aside.", "name": "Remove", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet, break apart ground Italian sausage with a spatula and cook until browned. (I did not have any extra oil in my pan, but if you do, you\u2019ll want to strain it off.)", "name": "Brown the sausage", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add jarred sauce and tomato paste to the browned Italian sausage and stir together to combine. The tomato paste helps thicken the sauce, which is very important for this recipe if you want to avoid a watery lasagna.", "name": "Thicken", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon a few spoonfuls of the finished sauce into the 9x13\u201d baking dish and spread around to cover the bottom. On top of the sauce, begin adding layers of zucchini, overlapping strips halfway to form a barrier to keep layers separate (just as you would with noodles!)", "name": "Spoon", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/zucchini-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-97583-step-0-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Then, add a layer of cheese mixture, another layer of zucchini, another layer of cheese, and a layer of sauce\u2014repeating this order until your lasagna pan is full. Thankfully, I remembered I had a roll of polenta in the pantry, so I sliced that up to fill in the spaces and then baked it for 45 mins.\r\n\r\nWhen served, the finished result didn't look as quite as pretty as the picture (it actually fell apart a bit), but no one cared at all because it was SO tasty and comforting. There are a couple of very good mid-priced brands that are often on sale at supermarkets. Add the butter to the still warm skillet (heat off) and allow it to melt. Either add 1/4 cup of the marinade or 1 tablespoon each of dijon and brown sugar to the skillet. Also add 1 cup of vegetable broth. Place the skillet over medium heat and whisk the mixture until all of the browned bits on the bottom of the skillet have dissolved off. Allow the mixture to simmer, whisking occasionally, until the volume has reduced by about half (about 15-20 min). NOTE: Never re-use the raw, uncooked marinade and never marinate at room temperature.", "name": "While the tenderloin is baking, prepare the pan sauce. As there are only 2 of us now, it's a perfect size for a small family--the only problem is that it's so lean that it's one of the most tasteless cuts of meat. I've often smoked it--a great solution, but too much work and time for a mid-week dinner. This marinade and pan sauce is pretty good, and I would like to see more of these recipes. Pork, coming to market at less than 6 months, is very sustainable--vs beef at 2 yrs--and a source of many nutrients that are difficult to find elsewhere naturally and work into one's diet. Cut for cut, pork is lower calorie than beef--I don't understand why many folks who eat meat and don't have religious restrictions avoid it!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2024-03-26"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "What is \"yellow sugar?\"", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2024-03-26"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "This was very good! My pork tender was about under $6, so I think that was a good value for 4 servings. I convection roasted at 400, and I used a probe thermometer \u2014 and pulled it at 140 (after less than 15 minutes, maybe like 12). My tender was over a pound, maybe not quite 1 1/3 pounds--they all vary. Since I roasted it in the same cast iron skillet I browned it in, I made the pan sauce while it rested. I was\r\nsurprised that the temp rose to 160 degrees, so next time, I will take it out  at 135 or lower. It was not dry at all; I just prefer a it little more pinkish. \r\n\r\nOnly change I would make would be to gently smash the garlic instead of mincing so I can pull it out. Even though I wiped off the marinade, the tiny bits of garlic stuck to the meat burned in the pan. I had to strain the pan sauce to get the burned bits out, but the sauce was great (I stirred the butter in at the end, off the heat) \u2014 I highly recommend not skipping the pan sauce! (I used a teaspoon of Better than Bullion roasted beef flavor and 1 cup of water instead of the vegetable broth. I marinated the meat the night before and made a quick lunch today (I work from home) with a baked sweet potato. I refuse to order expensive (and usually terrible) carryout! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/creamy-pesto-mac-spinach/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n2 cups uncooked macaroni ($0.50)\n2 Tbsp butter ($0.22)\n2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)\n2 cups whole milk ($0.60)\n1/2 cup grated Parmesan ($0.53)\n1/4 cup basil pesto ($1.33)\n1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)\nFreshly cracked pepper ($0.03)\n1/2 lb. frozen spinach ($0.80)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Thaw the spinach at room temperature or in the microwave. Squeeze out the excess water. Set the spinach aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then add the macaroni. Boil for 7-10 minutes, or until tender. Drain the macaroni in a colander.\n2. While the pasta is boiling, prepare the sauce. Add the butter and flour to a small sauce pot. Heat and stir the butter and flour over medium heat until it forms a creamy paste and begins to bubble. Continue to stir and cook for about one minute more.\n3. Whisk the milk into the butter and flour, then allow it to come up to a simmer, while whisking. When it reaches a simmer, the sauce will thicken. Remove the sauce from the heat.\n4. Whisk the Parmesan and pesto into the sauce until smooth. This will further thicken the sauce. Season the sauce with salt and freshly cracked pepper. Make sure the sauce is well seasoned as the flavors will be less concentrated once the pasta and spinach are stirred in.\n5. Return the cooked and drained pasta to the large pot (heat turned off) and add the thawed spinach. Pour the sauce over top, then stir until everything is combined and coated in sauce. Serve immediately.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Cook butter and flour\n0:15 Whisk in milk\n0:21 Whisk in Parmesan\n0:25 Whisk in pesto\n0:31 Season creamy pesto sauce\n0:37 Cook macaroni\n0:44 Combine macaroni, spinach, and sauce\n0:55 Eat and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-04-26T19:26:27+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/M8xVTe0s5AQ/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/M8xVTe0s5AQ?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M8xVTe0s5AQ", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 (1 cup each)"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups uncooked macaroni ($0.50)", "2 Tbsp butter ($0.22)", "2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)", "2 cups whole milk ($0.60)", "1/2 cup grated Parmesan ($0.53)", "1/4 cup basil pesto ($0.55)", "1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)", "Freshly cracked pepper ($0.03)", "1/2 lb. frozen spinach ($0.80)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Thaw the spinach at room temperature or in the microwave. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Sweet Potato Cornbread", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "Mashed sweet potato, fragrant spices, and rich sour cream make this Sweet Potato Cornbread a decadent fall treat.", "datePublished": "2020-11-02T12:25:06+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Sweet-Potato-Cornbread-butter-2.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Sweet-Potato-Cornbread-butter-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Sweet-Potato-Cornbread-butter-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Sweet-Potato-Cornbread-butter-2-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Sweet Potato Cornbread", "description": "This rich and sweet cornbread is full of warm spices and is the perfect dish for fall. Serve it as a side with dinner, with an egg for breakfast, or a drizzle of maple syrup for dessert! Get the full recipe here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2015/10/sweet-potato-cornbread/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 medium sweet potato (about 1 lb.) \n1.5 cups yellow cornmeal\n1 cup all-purpose flour \n1/2 cup sugar\n1 Tbsp baking powder\n1 tsp salt \n1/2 tsp cinnamon \n1/2 tsp nutmeg \n2 large eggs \n1/2 cup sour cream \n3/4 cup milk \n2 Tbsp canola or vegetable oil \n1/2 Tbsp canola or vegetable oil for the skillet \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Peel the sweet potato and cut it into one-inch cubes. Place the cubes in a pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil over high heat. Boil the potatoes until they're tender and fall apart with pierced with a fork (about ten minutes). Drain the potatoes and set aside.\n2. Coat the inside of a 10-inch cast iron skillet with oil. Place it in the oven and begin to preheat the oven to 425 degrees.\n3. In a large bowl, stir together the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg until well mixed.\n4. Mash the drained sweet potatoes until fairly smooth. Transfer 1.5 cups of the mashed potatoes to a large bowl. Add the sour cream, milk, and 2 Tbsp oil, and whisk until combined. Add the eggs and whisk until combined again.\n5. Pour the sweet potato mixture into the bowl with the dry ingredients. Stir the two together just until combined and no dry mix remains on the bottom of the bowl. It's okay if the mixture is a little lumpy, just be sure not to over mix.\n6. Carefully take the hot skillet out of the preheated oven and scoop the batter into it. Smooth the top out until it's even, then return it to the oven. Bake for 22-25 minutes, or until the center is puffed, the top is golden brown, and it's slightly cracked around the edges. Remove from the oven, cut into eight pieces, and serve. Preferably with butter.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2017-07-31T17:39:39+00:00", "duration": "PT1M6S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/OvcSRDiESRc/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/OvcSRDiESRc?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OvcSRDiESRc", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8"], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT55M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 lb. sweet potato ($1.56)", "1.5 cups yellow cornmeal ($0.36)", "1 cup all-purpose flour ($0.13)", "1/2 cup sugar ($0.40)", "1 Tbsp baking powder ($0.12)", "1 tsp salt ($0.05)", "1/2 tsp cinnamon ($0.05)", "1/2 tsp ground nutmeg ($0.05)", "2 large eggs ($0.52)", "1/2 cup sour cream ($0.47)", "3/4 cup milk ($0.23)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)", "1/2 Tbsp cooking oil for the skillet ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Peel the sweet potato and cut it into one-inch cubes. Make it vegetarian or vegan!", "datePublished": "2021-07-19T07:22:14+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Quick-Veggie-Pasta-fork.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Quick-Veggie-Pasta-fork-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Quick-Veggie-Pasta-fork-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Quick-Veggie-Pasta-fork-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Quick Veggie Pasta", "description": "Use up your leftover odds and ends in the kitchen because \"anything goes\" with this Quick Veggie Pasta! Make it vegetarian or vegan! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/quick-veggie-pasta/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 lb. linguine ($0.50)\n4 oz. mushrooms ($0.75)\n1 cup grape tomatoes ($1.25)\n1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)\n4 oz. fresh spinach ($0.50)\n1 Tbsp butter* ($0.09)\n1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)\n2 Tbsp nutritional yeast ($0.42)\n1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil for the pasta. Once boiling, add the pasta and continue to boil until the pasta is tender (about 7 minutes). Reserve a 1/2 cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta in a colander.\n2. While waiting for the water to boil, slice the mushrooms and cut the tomatoes in half.\n3. Heat the cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and a pinch of salt to the skillet and saut\u00e9 until they have released all of their moisture and water is no longer pooling on the bottom of the skillet (about 5-7 minutes).\n4. Add the tomatoes and saut\u00e9 for about two minutes more, or just until they're heated through (they'll continue to cook more after other ingredients are added). Add the spinach and saut\u00e9 just until wilted.\n5. Finally, add the cooked and drained pasta to the skillet along with the butter. Toss until everything is coated in melted butter. Turn the heat off.\n6. Season with garlic powder, nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper, then toss to coat. Give the pasta a taste and adjust the seasonings to your liking. If the pasta gets too dry as you're tossing with the seasoning, just add a splash of the reserved pasta water. Serve immediately and enjoy.\n\nNOTES\n*Swap with a vegan butter to make this recipe vegan.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Boil Pasta\n0:14 Reserve Pasta Water\n0:16 Drain Pasta\n0:17 Saut\u00e9 Mushrooms\n0:25 Add Tomatoes\n0:28 Add Spinach\n0:34 Add Pasta and Butter\n0:39 Season Pasta\n0:52 Serve and Enjoy", "uploadDate": "2021-08-22T15:00:10+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hREjkdDluLQ/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/hREjkdDluLQ?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hREjkdDluLQ", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 lb. linguine ($0.50)", "4 oz. mushrooms ($0.75)", "1 cup grape tomatoes ($1.25)", "1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)", "4 oz. fresh spinach ($0.50)", "1 Tbsp butter* ($0.09)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "2 Tbsp nutritional yeast ($0.42)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of water to a boil for the pasta. Loosely wrap the sweet potato in a paper towel, place on a microwave safe plate, and then microwave for 5 minutes on high. Squeeze the sweet potato to see if it is soft all the way through, and microwave for a few minutes longer if it isn\u2019t. Allow the sweet potato to cool slightly, and then scoop out the cooked flesh.", "name": "Rinse the sweet potato to remove any dirt and then prick with a fork. Loosely wrap the sweet potato in a paper towel, place on a microwave safe plate, and then microwave for 5 minutes on high. (Add four cups of water and one teaspoon of salt to a medium sauce pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Once it reaches a rolling boil, pour in the uncooked grits. Stir the mixture until it comes back up to a boil, then reduce the heat to the lowest setting, place a lid on top, and let simmer for ten minutes.)", "name": "Cook the grits according to the package directions. (Add four cups of water and one teaspoon of salt to a medium sauce pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Once it reaches a rolling boil, pour in the uncooked grits. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Mushroom Rice", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "This simple mushroom rice combines earthy mushrooms, savory garlic, rich butter, and flavorful vegetable broth for a simple yet flavorful side dish.", "datePublished": "2021-11-20T13:25:32+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Mushroom-Rice-close.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Mushroom-Rice-close-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Mushroom-Rice-close-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Mushroom-Rice-close-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Mushroom Rice", "description": "This simple mushroom rice combines earthy mushrooms, savory garlic, rich butter, and flavorful vegetable broth for a simple yet flavorful side dish. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs, serving suggestions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/mushroom-rice/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n8 oz. mushrooms ($1.49)\n2 cloves garlic ($0.16)\n3 Tbsp butter, divided ($0.30)\n1/4 tsp dried thyme ($0.03)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked pepper ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)\n1 cup long-grain white rice (uncooked) ($0.62)\n1.5 cups vegetable broth ($0.20)\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Slice the mushrooms and mince the garlic.\n2. Add the mushrooms, garlic, thyme, pepper, salt, and 1 Tbsp butter to a deep skillet. Saut\u00e9 over medium heat until the mushrooms have released all of their water and the water has evaporated off the bottom of the skillet.\n3. Add the rice and 2 Tbsp butter to the skillet and continue to saut\u00e9 for about two minutes more.\n4. Add the vegetable broth to the skillet and stir to dissolve any browned bits off the bottom of the skillet.\n5. Place a lid on the skillet, turn the heat up to medium-high, and allow the broth to come up to a full boil. When it reaches a full boil, turn the heat down to low, or just above low, so the broth remains simmering.\n6. Let the rice simmer for 15 minutes without stirring or removing the lid. After 15 minutes, remove the pan from the heat and let the rice rest for another 5 minutes, without removing the lid.\n7. Finally, remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork. Taste and add salt or pepper, if desired. Top with chopped fresh parsley as a garnish.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Add butter, garlic, and mushrooms to pan\n0:12 Add seasoning\n0:15 Saut\u00e9 mushrooms\n0:20 Add butter and rice\n0:26 Add broth\n0:30 Simmer\n0:34 Fluff\n0:37 Top with parsley and pepper\n0:43 Serve and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2022-01-09T06:00:05+00:00", "duration": "PT50S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Kb0SBblWHRs/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/Kb0SBblWHRs?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kb0SBblWHRs", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 \u00be cup each"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["8 oz. mushrooms ($1.49)", "2 cloves garlic ($0.16)", "3 Tbsp butter, divided ($0.30)", "1/4 tsp dried thyme ($0.03)", "1/4 tsp freshly cracked pepper ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.01)", "1 cup long-grain white rice (uncooked) ($0.62)", "1.5 cups vegetable broth ($0.20)", "1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice the mushrooms and mince the garlic.", "name": "Slice the mushrooms and mince the garlic.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/mushroom-rice/#wprm-recipe-59501-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the mushrooms, garlic, thyme, pepper, salt, and 1 Tbsp butter to a deep skillet. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/classic-baked-ziti/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 lb. Italian sausage (sweet, mild, or hot) ($3.49)\n1 yellow onion ($0.27)\n3 oz. tomato paste ($0.27)\n1 28 oz. can crushed tomatoes ($1.00)\n1 Tbsp Italian seasoning blend ($0.30)\n1/2 cup water ($0.00)\n1 lb. ziti ($1.67)\n1/2 Tbsp salt (for pasta water) ($0.05)\n15 oz. ricotta ($1.69)\n1 cup Italian cheese blend* ($1.15)\nfreshly cracked black pepper ($0.05)\n2 cups shredded mozzarella ($2.29)\n1 handful chopped parsley (optional, for garnish) ($0.20)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Brown the sausage in a large skillet or pot over medium heat, until it's brown and crispy on the edges (pork sausage contains a lot of fat, so I didn't add any extra to the skillet).\n2. While the sausage is browning, finely dice the onion. Add the onion to the skillet once the sausage has browned, and continue to saut\u00e9 over medium heat until the onion is soft and translucent.\n3. Add the tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, Italian seasoning, and \u00bd cup water to the skillet with the sausage and stir to combine. Place a lid on the skillet and allow it to come up to a simmer. Once simmering, turn the heat down and allow it to continue to simmer while you cook the ziti. Stir the sauce occasionally as it simmers.\n4. After getting the sauce started, begin the ziti. Bring a large pot of water with \u00bd Tbsp salt to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, add the ziti, and let it continue to boil until the ziti is tender (about 7-8 minutes). Drain the ziti in a colander. Shake the colander a bit to shake excess water out of the pasta.\n5. While the pasta and sauce are cooking, prepare the cheese filling. Add the ricotta, Italian cheese blend, and some freshly cracked black pepper (about 10 cranks of a pepper mill) to a bowl and stir to combine. Begin to preheat the oven to 350\u00baF.\n6. After draining the ziti, return it to the pot and add 1 cup of the red sauce. Stir to coat the cooked pasta in sauce.\n7. Pour half of the ziti to a 9x13\" baking dish. Add half of the ricotta mixture on top of the ziti in small dollops. Finally, spoon half of the red sauce and sausage over the pasta and ricotta. It's okay if the ingredients don't cover in a solid layer. Repeat these layers with the second half of the pasta, ricotta mixture, and sauce. Finally, top with 2 cups shredded mozzarella.\n8. Cover the baking dish with foil, making sure it's slightly tented so that it doesn't touch or stick to the melted cheese. Transfer the covered casserole to the oven and bake for 20 minutes.\n9. After baking for 20 minutes, remove the foil, and turn the oven on to broil (keep the casserole on the middle rack, about 10-12 inches from the broiler). Broil for 5 minutes, or just until the cheese is slightly browned. Keep a close eye on the baked ziti as it broils, because broilers can vary in intensity. Top with chopped parsley, if desired, then serve.\n\nNOTES\n*In place of Italian cheese blend you can use a mix of mozzarella and Parmesan.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Brown sausage\n0:10 Add onion\n0:14 Add seasoning, tomatoes, and water\n0:25 Simmer sauce\n0:27 Make cheese mixture\n0:35 Boil ziti\n0:42 Combine ziti and a little sauce\n0:45 Layer ziti, cheese, and sauce\n0:59 Top with mozzarella\n1:02 Cover and bake\n1:08 Uncover and broil\n1:15 Top with parsley\n1:17 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-05-02T15:08:31+00:00", "duration": "PT1M26S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wSDBUnvGL2I/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wSDBUnvGL2I?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wSDBUnvGL2I", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT55M", "totalTime": "PT65M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 lb. ground Italian sausage (sweet, mild, or hot) ($4.99)", "1  yellow onion ($0.27)", "3 oz. tomato paste ($0.50)", "1 28oz. can crushed tomatoes ($1.89)", "1 Tbsp Italian seasoning blend ($0.30)", "1/2 cup water ($0.00)", "1 lb. ziti ($1.67)", "1/2 Tbsp salt (for pasta water) ($0.05)", "15 oz. ricotta ($3.39)", "1 cup Italian cheese blend* ($1.24)", "1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.05)", "2  cups  shredded mozzarella ($2.29)", "1 handful chopped
