Ready in about 30 minutes!Step-by-step photos can be seen below the recipe card.", "datePublished": "2025-06-04T08:30:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Thai_Curry_Vegetable_Overhead.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Thai_Curry_Vegetable_Overhead-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Thai_Curry_Vegetable_Overhead-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Thai_Curry_Vegetable_Overhead-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Thai Curry Vegetable Soup", "description": "This Thai Curry Vegetable Soup is packed with vegetables, spicy Thai flavor, and creamy coconut milk. Ready in about 30 minutes! FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPrintable recipe here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/thai-curry-vegetable-soup/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n2 Tbsp neutral cooking oil\n2 cloves garlic \n1 Tbsp grated fresh ginger \n2 Tbsp Thai red curry paste \n1 small sweet potato (about 1 lb.)\n1 bunch baby bok choy\n4 cups vegetable or chicken broth \n13 oz can coconut milk \n1/2 Tbsp fish sauce\n1/2 Tbsp brown sugar \n3.5 oz rice vermicelli noodles \n\nGARNISHES (OPTIONAL)\n1/2 red onion \n1 lime \nHandful fresh cilantro \nSriracha to taste \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n\n1) Prepare the vegetables for the soup and garnishes first, so they're ready to go when needed. Mince the garlic and grate the ginger using a small-holed cheese grater. Peel and dice the sweet potato into one-inch cubes. Wash the bok choy well, then chop into one-inch strips, separating the fibrous stalks from the delicate green ends. Thinly slice the red onion and roughly chop the cilantro.\n\n2) Add the cooking oil to a large soup pot along with the minced garlic, grated ginger, and Thai red curry paste. Saut\u00e9 the garlic, ginger, and curry paste over medium heat for 1-2 minutes.\n\n3) Add the diced sweet potato and chopped bok choy stalks to the pot (save the leafy green ends for later) along with the chicken or vegetable broth. Bring the pot to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender.\n\n4) While the soup is simmering, bring a small pot of water to a boil for the vermicelli. Once boiling, add the vermicelli and boil for 2-3 minutes, or just until tender. Drain the rice noodles in a colander and set aside.\n5) Once the sweet potatoes are tender, add the coconut milk, fish sauce, and brown sugar to the soup. Stir, taste, and adjust the fish sauce or brown sugar if needed. Finally, add the bok choy greens and let them wilt in the hot soup.\n\n6) To serve, divide the rice vermicelli among four bowls. Ladle the soup and vegetables over the noodles, then top with red onion, cilantro, a wedge or two of lime, and a drizzle of sriracha.\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-10-06T23:26:20+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4LrXueZPU6g/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/4LrXueZPU6g?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LrXueZPU6g", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 (about 2 cups each)"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 Tbsp neutral cooking oil ($0.17 *)", "2 cloves garlic (minced (1 Tbsp) $0.12)", "1 Tbsp fresh ginger (peeled and grated, $0.05)", "3 Tbsp Thai red curry paste ($1.49 **)", "1 small sweet potato (peeled and 1-inch cubed (about 1 lb.) $0.91)", "2  baby bok choy (chopped into 1-inch strips (a little less than 1 lb.) $1.56)", "4 cups vegetable or chicken broth (32 oz. $0.47)", "3.5 oz. uncooked rice vermicelli noodles ($0.36 ***)", "1 13oz. can full fat coconut milk ($2.98)", "1/2 Tbsp fish sauce ($0.16 ****)", "1/2 Tbsp brown sugar ($0.03)", "1/2  red onion (thinly sliced (about 1/2 cup) $0.32)", "1  lime ($0.25)", "1 handful fresh cilantro (chopped, $0.28)", "Sriracha (to taste, $0.15)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the vegetables for the soup and garnishes first, if you haven&#39;t already. Is it allowed to cook the same meal twice in a row?", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kevin"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-06"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "One of the best recipes on this site! I've been making it for years. Anyone who hasn't yet tried it should read through the comments as there are so many ways to vary this delicious and flexible recipe. I just threw it together for lunch today--I used shaved carrot &amp; celery, a couple of sliced mushrooms, sliced onion &amp; red bell pepper, a couple of lonely mushrooms, several snow peas, and spinach for the greens--I think all of these are included in your suggestions. The only challenge is to remember that this is soup--it needs to be fairly thin. For noodles, I used shiratake--those calorie free noodles made from a Japanese root vegetable, konjac, and widely available in produce sections with the egg roll and wonton wrappers (they don't smell good when you open the package, so do as directed and rinse them well in a colander and they will be perfectly fine!). They have no taste, but a nice springy mouth feel and absorb other soup flavors. Beth, in one of replies, mentions using an Asian grocery store--the closest to me is about 60 miles, but whenever I'm in a larger urban area, I hit one of those and stock up on plenty of things!!! The prices are amazing, the produce wonderful, plus they carry authentic Asian brands not available in most American supermarkets. The staff in every one where I've shopped has been amazing--helpful and pleasant--so if you are overwhelmed when first you step into one, ask for help!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-05"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "reviewBody": "Delicious!! It\u2019s our go-to chocolate chip cookie recipe now.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "ACK"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-27"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "1"}, "reviewBody": "Drier and crispier than a desert", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Roger"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-26"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Thank you, this is a wonderful cookie recipe! I appreciate that all it took to make were pantry staples and the recipe came together quickly. \r\n\r\nI ended up making a double batch because I had just bought some bougie butter from Costco that comes in large bricks and I didn\u2019t want to just use half a brick of butter. \r\n\r\nI wanted to make the bistro-style cookies, so I used a 1/4 cup measuring cup to portion out each cookie (which is the equivalent of two ounces of cookie dough). I baked the cookies for 14 minutes; when the timer beeped, the cookies had just barely set up around the edges and had not really browned yet. I took them out anyway because I wanted them to be super gooey inside (I\u2019m more worried about an over-baked cookie than an underbaked one). \r\n\r\nI let the cookies cool on the baking tray for about 10 minutes; this is when I nestled some more chocolate chips into the tops and sprinkled them with Maldon sea salt flakes. I then transferred them onto a wire rack to finish cooling (I kept the parchment paper I had lined my baking tray with under the cookies when I transferred them to the wire cooling rack). \r\n\r\nThe cookies had a really interesting and fun texture and flavor profile. They were a bit crispy on the edges and from the flaky salt, but still opulently soft and gooey and chocolatey in the inside. They were familiarly sweet, but had a fun pop of flavor from the salt. \r\n\r\nI put the cookie dough for the second batch in the fridge while the first batch was baking in the thought that it might make the second batch of cookies thicker, but they ended up being the same thickness as the first batch. \r\n\r\nI now have the enviable problem of having too many cookies in my house; a double batch made 23 enormous, artisanal cookies. I will definitely have to freeze the extras!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Miranda M"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-24"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Thank you, this is a wonderful cookie recipe! I took them out anyway because I wanted them to be super gooey inside (I\u2019m more worried about an over-baked cookie than an underbaked one).\r\n\r\nI let the cookies cool on the baking tray for about 10 minutes; this is when I nestled some more chocolate chips into the tops and sprinkled them with Maldon sea salt flakes. They were a bit crispy on the edges and from the flaky salt, but still opulently soft and gooey and chocolatey in the inside. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2009/12/garlic-noodles/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n8 oz angel hair pasta \n4 cloves garlic \n1/2 bunch green onions\n4 Tbsp butter \n2 tsp soy sauce \n2 Tbsp brown sugar \n1 tsp sesame oil \n2 Tbsp oyster sauce \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Add the oyster sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce and sesame oil to a bowl and stir until combined.\nBring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the package directions (boil for 7-10 minutes). Drain the cooked noodles in a colander, then set aside.\n2. While the pasta cooks, mince the garlic and slice the green onions. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Once the butter is melted and bubbly, add the garlic and onions (save a few for garnish) and saut\u00e9 until they are soft and fragrant (1-2 minutes).\n3. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the drained pasta and oyster sauce mixture to the skillet, and stir well to coat the pasta. If your pasta is stiff or sticky making it hard to stir, sprinkle a small amount of hot water over the pasta to loosen it up. Garnish the pasta with any reserved sliced green onions, then serve.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2017-08-05T15:02:39+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QLfybDBN2H0/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/QLfybDBN2H0?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLfybDBN2H0", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 Tbsp oyster sauce* ($0.23)", "2 Tbsp brown sugar** ($0.06)", "2 tsp soy sauce ($0.10)", "1 tsp toasted sesame oil ($0.40)", "8 oz angel hair pasta*** ($0.54)", "4 cloves garlic ($0.16)", "1/2  bunch green onions ($0.35)", "4 Tbsp butter ($0.50)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the oyster sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce and sesame oil to a bowl and stir until combined.", "name": "Add the oyster sauce, brown sugar, soy sauce and sesame oil to a bowl and stir until combined.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/garlic-noodles/#wprm-recipe-118206-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the package directions (boil for 7-10 minutes). This Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal is perfect for breakfast meal prep!Step-by-step photos can be seen below the recipe card.", "datePublished": "2020-07-16T10:07:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/Banana-Bread-Baked-Oatmeal-finished.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/Banana-Bread-Baked-Oatmeal-finished-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/Banana-Bread-Baked-Oatmeal-finished-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/12/Banana-Bread-Baked-Oatmeal-finished-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal", "description": "The rich and sweet flavor of banana bread infused into a healthy baked oatmeal. This Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal is perfect for breakfast meal prep! FULL RECIPE BELOW. \n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/banana-bread-oatmeal/\n\nIngredients\n    1 1/2 cups mashed banana (about 3 bananas) ($0.63)\n    1/3 cup brown sugar ($0.12)\n    2 large eggs ($0.46)\n    1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)\n    1/2 tsp vanilla extract ($0.15)\n    1 tsp baking powder ($0.02)\n    1/4 tsp cinnamon ($0.02)\n    1/8 tsp nutmeg ($0.02)\n    2 cups milk ($0.75)\n    2 1/2 cups old-fashioned rolled oats ($0.45)\n    1/2 cup chopped walnuts ($0.60)\n\nInstructions\n1. Preheat the oven to 375\u00baF. Mash the bananas well with a fork (you'll need 1.5 cups).\n2. Add the mashed bananas to a large bowl along with the brown sugar, eggs, salt, vanilla, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Whisk until the ingredients are combined.\n3. Add the milk and whisk until combined again.\n4. Finally, stir in the rolled oats and chopped walnuts.\n5. Pour the oat mixture into a 9x9-inch casserole dish and transfer to the preheated oven. Bake for 45 minutes, or until it is golden brown on top and around the edges.\n6. Serve warm or refrigerate and enjoy cold!\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Combine wet ingredients\n0:27 Fold in oats and walnuts\n0:37 Pour into baking dish\n0:42 Bake\n0:46 Serve", "uploadDate": "2021-01-31T18:30:11+00:00", "duration": "PT1M", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1MWCbkuV6vM/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/1MWCbkuV6vM?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MWCbkuV6vM", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT55M", "recipeIngredient": ["3  bananas (mashed, (1\u00bd cups total) $0.84)", "\u2153 cup brown sugar  ($0.15)", "2  large eggs  ($0.58)", "\u00bd tsp salt  ($0.02)", "\u00bd tsp vanilla extract  ($0.65)", "1 tsp baking powder  ($0.02)", "\u00bc tsp ground cinnamon  ($0.02)", "\u215b tsp ground nutmeg  ($0.02)", "2 cups milk  ($0.36*)", "2\u00bd cups old-fashioned rolled oats ($0.68)", "\u00bd cup chopped walnuts  ($0.60)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00baF. Pattypan works with this, too. My midwestern mom often used crushed potato chips as a topping, if she didn't have crackers. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/bbq-cheddar-baked-chicken/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 pounds total) ($7.58)\n1 tsp smoked paprika ($0.10)\n1/2 tsp garlic powder ($0.05)\n1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n1/4 cup BBQ sauce ($0.13)\n1 cup shredded cheddar ($0.85)\n1/4 cup diced red onion ($0.05)\n1/4 cup chopped cilantro ($0.09)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. If your chicken breasts are very thick or uneven in thickness, use a mallet or rolling pin to first pound them out to a more even thickness. Slice the chicken breasts in half, so you have four pieces.\n2. Combine the smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Pat the chicken dry with paper towel, then sprinkle the seasoning mix over both sides of each piece of chicken.\n3. Place the seasoned chicken pieces in a baking dish, then spoon 1 Tbsp BBQ sauce over top of each piece, spreading it from edge to edge to cover the chicken.\n4. Bake the chicken in the preheated 400\u00baF oven for about 18 minutes (less for smaller or thinner pieces).\n5. Remove the chicken from the oven and top each piece with shredded cheddar. Return the chicken to the oven and continue baking for five minutes, or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165\u00baF.\n6. After baking the chicken, let the chicken rest for five minutes, then top with diced red onion and chopped cilantro just before serving.\n\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:10 Pound and cut chicken\n0:13 Season chicken\n0:18 Add BBQ sauce\n0:24 Bake chicken\n0:29 Add cheddar\n0:33 Bake again\n0:37 Top with cilantro and onion\n0:42 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-08-01T16:17:54+00:00", "duration": "PT55S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/GmBTv9J9emI/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/GmBTv9J9emI?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmBTv9J9emI", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT23M", "totalTime": "PT33M", "recipeIngredient": ["2  boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 pounds total) ($7.58)", "1 tsp smoked paprika ($0.10)", "1/2 tsp garlic powder ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)", "1/4 cup BBQ sauce ($0.13)", "1 cup shredded cheddar ($0.85)", "1/4 cup diced red onion ($0.05)", "1/4 cup chopped cilantro ($0.09)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Let the pot simmer on low for 15 minutes. Stir it every five minutes or so while it's simmering. Make sure it's simmering (bubbling) the whole time. I would like to add my own version if you like which I've made for the last 10 years. I only buy asparagus when it goes down to 1.99 / lb.  First the asparagus is marinated in olive oil, lemon juice and S&amp;P for a few hours. Then you'd fire up the grill and over medium heat lay out the asparagus. Cook until limp and darkened, some prefer black. Pick off the small ones as they will cook first and eat as the others cook. I try to buy only medium size stalks. Avoid the tiny thin ones as well as the large woody ones.  It should take 15 - 20 min. depending on the size of the veg. and your heat. A more gourmet version I've heard would be to wrap a few stalks in Prosciutto or Fontina cheese. Make the vinaigrette first, so the flavors have a little time to blend. In a bowl or jar, combine the olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper. Whisk the ingredients together, or close the jar and shake until combined. Set the vinaigrette aside.\n2. If you want to soften the flavor of the red onion a bit, slice it then soak the slices in ice water for about five minutes before dicing. Otherwise, finely dice the red onion, cut the cucumber into quarter rounds, slice the tomatoes in half, and roughly chop the parsley.\n3. Combine the cucumber, tomato, onion, and parsley in a bowl. Pour the vinaigrette over top, then stir until the vegetables are coated.\n4. Rinse and drain the beans, and drain the tuna. Add the beans, tuna, and feta to the salad, then gently stir to combine. These three are added last and only gently stirred to make sure the tuna remains in larger flakes instead of falling apart into tiny pieces.\n5. Serve immediately, or refrigerate up to four days. Give it a quick stir after refrigerating and before serving to redistribute the dressing.\n\nNOTES\n*You can use a conventional cucumber and diced Roma tomatoes in place of English cucumber and grape tomatoes if needed. \n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Make vinaigrette\n0:22 Combine vegetables for salad\n0:27 Add vinaigrette and stir to coat\n0:35 Add beans, tuna, and feta\n0:40 Fold to combine\n0:50 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-02-21T15:30:16+00:00", "duration": "PT59S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XcH7rQ-ThKA/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/XcH7rQ-ThKA?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XcH7rQ-ThKA", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 about 1 cup each"], "prepTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup olive oil ($0.88)", "2 Tbsp red wine vinegar ($0.20)", "1 Tbsp lemon juice ($0.06)", "1 tsp dried oregano ($0.10)", "1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp black pepper (freshly cracked, $0.02)", "1  cucumber ($1.29*)", "1 pint grape tomatoes ($2.48*)", "1/2  red onion ($0.49)", "1/4 bunch fresh parsley (chopped, (about \u00bd cup) $0.35)", "1 15 oz. can cannellini beans ($0.94)", "1 12 oz. can chunk light tuna ($2.50**)", "2 oz. feta cheese ($1.42)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the vinaigrette first, so the flavors have a little time to blend. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/ginger-salmon/\n\nShown with Sesame Roasted Green Beans: https://www.budgetbytes.com/sesame-roasted-green-beans/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 tsp grated fresh ginger ($0.10)\n1 clove garlic, minced ($0.08)\n2 Tbsp brown sugar ($0.08)\n1 tsp soy sauce ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp toasted sesame oil ($0.02)\n1 lb. fresh salmon ($7.57)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 425\u00baF. Grate about 1 tsp fresh ginger. Combine the ginger, garlic, brown sugar, soy sauce, and toasted sesame oil in a bowl.\n2. Cut the salmon into four equal portions. Place the portioned salmon on a baking sheet lined with parchment or foil, skin side down.\n3. Spread the prepared ginger glaze over the top of each piece of salmon.\n4. Bake the salmon for about 20 minutes (15 minutes for thin fillets), or until the internal temperature reaches 145\u00baF. Serve immediately.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Make ginger glaze\n0:20 Cut salmon into portions\n0:26 Place salmon on baking sheet\n0:31 Coat salmon with ginger glaze\n0:37 Bake salmon\n0:45 Serve and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2021-03-27T18:18:16+00:00", "duration": "PT58S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cHyn_f0i7cM/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/cHyn_f0i7cM?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cHyn_f0i7cM", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tsp grated fresh ginger ($0.10)", "1 clove  garlic, minced ($0.08)", "2 Tbsp brown sugar ($0.08)", "1 tsp soy sauce ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp toasted sesame oil ($0.02)", "1 lb. fresh salmon ($7.57)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00baF. Perfect for salads, bowl meals, noodles, wraps, and more.", "datePublished": "2021-09-11T10:40:09+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Honey-Sriracha-Tofu-close.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Honey-Sriracha-Tofu-close-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Honey-Sriracha-Tofu-close-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Honey-Sriracha-Tofu-close-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Honey Sriracha Tofu", "description": "This sweet, spicy, and sticky honey sriracha tofu is addictively delicious! Add it to salads, bowl meals, wraps, and more. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs, serving suggestions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/honey-sriracha-tofu/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n14 oz. extra firm tofu ($1.79)\n2 Tbsp sriracha ($0.22)\n2 Tbsp honey ($0.24)\n2 tsp soy sauce, divided ($0.04)\n1/4 tsp crushed red pepper ($0.02)\n2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.08)\n1 Tbsp cornstarch ($0.03)\n2 green onions, sliced ($0.22)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Press the tofu for 30 minutes to remove the excess moisture. You can do this by either using a tofu press, or placing the block of tofu on a rimmed plate or tray, then topping with something flat like a cutting board and placing a heavy object on top (cast iron skillet or pot of water). After pressing for 30 minutes, pour off the extra liquid.\n2. While the tofu is pressing, make the honey sriracha sauce. In a small bowl, combine the sriracha, honey, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and the crushed red pepper. Set the sauce aside.\n3. Cut the pressed tofu into \u00bd-inch cubes. Use a paper towel to lightly pat dry the tofu cubes.\n4. Add the cooking oil and 1 teaspoon soy sauce to a large bowl. Lightly whisk the soy sauce into the oil. Add the cubed tofu and gently stir until the tofu is coated in oil and soy sauce.\n5. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon cornstarch over the cubed tofu and gently stir. Repeat two more times, or until 3 teaspoon (1 Tablespoon) cornstarch has been added to the tofu.\n6. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium. When the skillet is hot, add the prepared tofu. The tofu will fry in the oil that is coating the cubes. Cook the tofu, stirring only occasionally, until it is brown and crispy on all sides (about 10 minutes).\n7. Pour the honey sriracha sauce over the tofu and continue to stir and cook for 1-2 more minutes, or until the glaze is thick and sticky.\n8. Top the honey sriracha tofu with sliced green onions and serve.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Make honey sriracha sauce\n0:18 Cut tofu into cubes\n0:25 Coat tofu in oil and cornstarch\n0:37 Fry tofu\n0:43 Add honey sriracha sauce\n0:48 Top with green onion and sesame seeds\n0:53 Serve and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2021-12-12T15:47:24+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Gfqzon0P9nM/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/Gfqzon0P9nM?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gfqzon0P9nM", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["14 oz. extra firm tofu ($1.79)", "2 Tbsp sriracha ($0.22)", "2 Tbsp honey ($0.24)", "2 tsp soy sauce, divided ($0.04)", "1/4 tsp crushed red pepper ($0.02)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.08)", "1 Tbsp cornstarch ($0.03)", "2  green onions, sliced ($0.22)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Press the tofu for 30 minutes to remove the excess moisture. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/skillet-cheeseburger-pasta/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 yellow onion ($0.25)\n1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.16)\n1/2 lb. ground beef ($2.50)\n2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)\n1 8oz. can tomato sauce ($0.29)\n2 cups beef broth ($0.26)\n1/2 lb. pasta shells, uncooked ($0.50)\n4 oz. cheddar cheese, shredded ($0.75)\n2 Tbsp hot dog relish ($0.16)\n2 green onions, sliced (optional) ($0.20)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Finely dice the onion. Add the onion, olive oil, and ground beef to a large deep skillet and saut\u00e9 over medium heat until the beef is fully browned and the onion is soft and translucent. Drain off any excess fat, if needed.\n2. Add the flour to the skillet and continue to stir and cook for one minute more. The flour will begin to coat the bottom of the skillet. Be careful not to let the flour burn.\n3. Add the tomato sauce and beef broth to the skillet and stir to dissolve the flour off the bottom of the skillet.\n4. Add the uncooked pasta to the skillet and stir to combine. The liquid in the skillet may not fully cover the pasta, but that is okay.\n5. Place a lid on the skillet, turn the heat up to medium-high, and let the liquid come up to a boil. Once it reaches a boil, give it a quick stir to loosen any pasta from the bottom of the skillet, replace the lid, and turn the heat down to low. Let the pasta simmer, stirring occasionally (always replacing the lid), for about 10 minutes, or until the pasta is tender and the sauce has thickened. Turn the heat off.\n6. Add the shredded cheddar to the skillet and stir until it has melted into the sauce. Stir the hot dog relish into the sauce and then top with sliced green onions. Serve hot.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Saut\u00e9 ground beef & onion\n0:15 Add flour to beef\n0:18 Add pasta, tomato sauce, and broth\n0:25 Bring pot to a boil\n0:27 Simmer and stir\n0:34 Stir in cheddar\n0:39 Add relish\n0:43 Top with green onion\n0:47 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-05-30T15:00:11+00:00", "duration": "PT59S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/i2LlxfJ-Ti0/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/i2LlxfJ-Ti0?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i2LlxfJ-Ti0", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  yellow onion  ($0.25)", "1 Tbsp olive oil  ($0.16)", "1/2 lb. ground beef  ($2.50)", "2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)", "1 8oz. can tomato sauce  ($0.29)", "2 cups beef broth ($0.26)", "1/2  lb. pasta shells, uncooked ($0.50)", "4 oz. cheddar cheese, shredded ($0.75)", "2 Tbsp hot dog relish ($0.16)", "2  green onions, sliced (optional) ($0.20)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Finely dice the onion. For what it\u2019s worth, this did *not* taste bland to me - full of acidity from the tomato sauce and relish (no hot dog relish where I live; just use one part yellow mustard to two parts dill relish) and umami from the meat (or \u201cmeat\u201d in my case), onions, and cheese. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chicken Alfredo", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "This Chicken Alfredo recipe features pasta drenched in an ultra-rich and creamy sauce, topped with juicy strips of seared chicken.", "datePublished": "2022-07-25T09:34:20+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/Chicken-Alfredo-above.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/Chicken-Alfredo-above-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/Chicken-Alfredo-above-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/Chicken-Alfredo-above-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Chicken Alfredo", "description": "This Chicken Alfredo features pasta drenched in an ultra-rich and creamy sauce, topped with juicy strips of seared chicken.FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-alfredo/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 lb. total) ($6.49)\n2 tsp Italian seasoning ($0.20)\n1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)\n2 Tbsp butter ($0.22)\n4 cloves garlic, minced ($0.32)\n1 cup heavy cream ($1.25)\n3/4 cup grated Parmesan ($1.08)\n1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp pepper ($0.02)\n1 Tbsp chopped parsley (optional garnish) ($0.10)\n8 oz. fettuccine ($0.88)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS \n1. Season both sides of the chicken breast with Italian seasoning and a pinch of salt.\n2. Heat a large skillet over medium. Once hot, add the cooking oil and swirl to coat the surface. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for about 7-8 minutes on each side, or until browned on the outside and cooked through.\n3. Remove the chicken to a clean plate and turn the heat under the skillet down to medium-low.\n4. Add the butter and minced garlic to the skillet. Stir and cook the garlic in the melted butter for about two minutes, dissolving the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet as you stir.\n5. Add the heavy cream and whisk to combine, dissolving any remaining browned bits. Allow the cream to come up to a simmer.\n6. While waiting for the cream to simmer, bring a pot of water to a boil for the fettuccine. Once boiling, add the pasta and continue to boil until tender (about 7 minutes). Reserve about \u00bd cup of the starchy cooking water just before draining the pasta.\n7. Once the cream is simmering, add the grated Parmesan to the skillet. Continue to whisk and stir until the Parmesan has melted into the sauce and the sauce has begun to simmer. Simmer the sauce for a few minutes, or until it becomes slightly thicker. Add salt and pepper to the sauce to taste.\n8. Add the drained pasta to the skillet with the creamy sauce and toss to combine. If the sauce becomes too thick, add a couple of tablespoons of the reserved pasta water and toss to combine with the sauce.\n9. Slice the cooked chicken breasts and serve it atop the creamy pasta. Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIME STAMPS \n0:00 Introduction\n0:05 Season chicken & cook in a skillet\n0:16 Remove chicken & add garlic & butter to skillet\n0:20 Add heavy cream to skillet & stir\n0:24 Add parmesan cheese to skillet & stir\n0:28 Season cream with salt & pepper\n0:32 Boil pasta\n0:38 Add cooked pasta to sauce & stir\n0:44 Top with sliced chicken & garnish\n0:46 Enjoy & serve\n\n#chickenalfredo #chickenalfredopasta #pasta #pastarecipe #pastarecipes", "uploadDate": "2022-10-30T15:00:10+00:00", "duration": "PT53S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QFzbpVZUCvU/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/QFzbpVZUCvU?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFzbpVZUCvU", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT35M", "totalTime": "PT40M", "recipeIngredient": ["2  boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1.3 lb. total, $6.49)", "2 tsp Italian seasoning ($0.20)", "1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04*)", "2 Tbsp butter ($0.22)", "4 cloves garlic (minced, $0.32)", "1 cup heavy cream ($1.25**)", "\u00be cup grated Parmesan ($1.08***)", "\u00bc tsp salt ($0.02)", "\u00bc tsp pepper ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp parsley (chopped, optional garnish $0.10)", "8 oz. fettuccine ($0.88****)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season both sides of the chicken breast with Italian seasoning and a pinch of salt.", "name": "Season both sides of the chicken breast with Italian seasoning and a pinch of salt.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-alfredo/#wprm-recipe-67806-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat a large skillet over medium. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Baked Beef Tacos", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "Baked Beef Tacos are a fast and easy way to take Taco Tuesday to the next level and is the perfect fast and easy weeknight meal.", "datePublished": "2019-05-11T13:06:16+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Baked-Beef-and-Black-Bean-Tacos-with-toppings.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Baked-Beef-and-Black-Bean-Tacos-with-toppings-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Baked-Beef-and-Black-Bean-Tacos-with-toppings-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Baked-Beef-and-Black-Bean-Tacos-with-toppings-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Baked Beef and Black Bean Tacos", "description": "Baked Beef and Black Bean Tacos are a fast and easy way to take Taco Tuesday to the next level and is the perfect fast and easy weeknight meal. FULL RECIPE BELOW. \n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/baked-beef-black-bean-tacos/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\nTACO SEASONING\n1 Tbsp chili powder \n1 tsp smoked paprika\n1 tsp cumin\n1/2 tsp oregano \n1/4 tsp cayenne\n1/2 tsp salt \nFreshly cracked pepper \n\nTACOS\n1 Tbsp cooking oil \n1 yellow onion \n2 cloves garlic \n1/2 lb lean ground beef (93% lean or higher)* \n15 oz can black beans\n1 box 10 hard taco shells\n1 cup shredded cheddar (4oz.) \n\nOPTIONAL TOPPINGS\n1 tomato \n1 jalape\u00f1o \nHandful fresh cilantro \n1/4 cup sour cream \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. In a small bowl, combine the ingredients for the taco seasoning, then set the seasoning aside (or use one envelope of store-bought taco seasoning). Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF.\n2. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Add the onion, garlic, and cooking oil to a large skillet. Saut\u00e9 the onion and garlic over medium heat until the onion is soft and translucent (about 5 minutes). Add the ground beef and prepared taco seasoning and continue to saut\u00e9 until the beef is cooked through (another 5 minutes).\n3. Arrange the taco shells in a casserole dish so they are all standing upright. If you do not have a dish that fits them snuggly enough to hold them up, use balled up aluminum foil to act as \"book ends\" to help hold the line of tacos upright.\n4. Drain the can of black beans well, but do not rinse them. A little sauciness helps keep the beef mixture moist.Stir the beans into the seasoned beef and allow them to heat through.\n5. Fill the tacos with the beef and bean mixture. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over top. Bake the tacos in the preheated oven for 7-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the taco shells are golden brown on the edges.\n6. While the tacos are baking, dice the tomato, slice the jalape\u00f1o, and roughly chop the cilantro leaves. Sprinkle the diced tomato, jalape\u00f1o, and cilantro over the tacos, and add a dollop of sour cream just before serving.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-07-27T22:01:21+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/MU50rxvgCfA/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/MU50rxvgCfA?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MU50rxvgCfA", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["5", "5 (2 tacos each)"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 Tbsp chili powder ($0.30)", "1 tsp smoked paprika ($0.10)", "1 tsp ground cumin ($0.10)", "1/2 tsp dried oregano ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp cayenne pepper ($0.03)", "1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)", "Freshly cracked black pepper ($0.03)", "1 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.04)", "1  yellow onion ($0.37)", "2 cloves garlic ($0.16)", "1/2 lb. lean ground beef (93% lean or higher)* ($3.90)", "1 15oz. can black beans ($0.79)", "1 box hard taco shells (10 shells) ($1.00)", "1 cup shredded cheddar (4oz.) I do this because the first batch I made felt a little bland on its own. It was perfect reheated with some avocado and fresh salsa on top. I\u2019ve made so many of these because it\u2019s easy to reheat and feel like I\u2019m eating a relatively healthy, fresh lunch.\u00a0\r\n\r\nFor those wondering how to reheat from frozen. The best, fastest way I\u2019ve found is to loosely wrap in a slightly damp paper towel (helps keeps the ends from drying out) and heating in microwave for around 2 minutes, Then tossing in a pan over medium heat until you get a nice gold crust on all sides. We're vegan, so we used vegan cheese, and we don't like cilantro, so we just left that part out. Also used brown rice instead of white, because that's what we had on hand. Otherwise, we made them according to your directions. Honestly, we may also leave the cheese out next time, because it didn't really add much. The roasted veggies (especially the red onion - wow!) are the stars here, and really pull everything together. I had one this morning for breakfast straight out of the fridge, no warming up or anything, and it was so tasty - the flavors had actually improved sitting in the fridge for a couple days. My husband liked how easy and quick they were to cook and assemble - roasting veggies takes time, but after the chopping you can mostly walk away and do something else while they cook. We will definitely make again. In fact, we may double (or triple) the recipe and stock up our freezer with these things! Mix together until well combined and set aside.", "name": "Mix", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/white-chicken-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-111591-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Next, remove the skin from the cooked rotisserie chicken and pull the meat off of the bones. Drain the pasta in a colander.", "name": "Boil", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/white-chicken-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-111591-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F. Saut\u00e9 for 4 minutes or until the onion is translucent.", "name": "Saute", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/white-chicken-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-111591-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the flour and cook until the flour starts to turn light brown. Now slowly pour in the chicken broth and whisk the broth with the flour mixture until combined. Keep whisking or stirring until there are no lumps in the sauce.", "name": "Whisk", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/white-chicken-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-111591-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the Italian seasoning, \u00bd tsp salt, \u00bc tsp black pepper, garlic powder, heavy cream and \u00bc cup grated parmesan cheese to the sauce. Stir to combine. Now add the chopped spinach to the sauce and stir to combine.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/white-chicken-lasagna/#wprm-recipe-111591-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Time to assemble the lasagna. Spread about 1 cup of the sauce over the bottom of a 9\u00d713-inch casserole dish. Lay three noodles on top of the sauce. Spread \u2153 of the ricotta cheese mixture evenly over the noodles. Then top with \u2153 of the shredded chicken. Repeat the layers (sauce, noodles, ricotta, chicken) two more times. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/southern-style-potato-salad/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n3 lbs. Yukon Gold potatoes ($3.49)\n1 tsp. salt ($0.03)\n2 large eggs ($0.42)\n3/4 cup mayonnaise ($0.75)\n1 Tbsp yellow mustard ($0.08)\n1 Tbsp sweet relish ($0.08)\n1 Tbsp red wine vinegar ($0.10)\n1/2 tsp Tony Chachere\u2019s seasoning* ($0.05)\n1/4 tsp Freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n2 green onions ($0.22)\n2 ribs celery (1 cup chopped) ($0.32)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Peel, wash, and chop your potatoes into one inch cubes. Briefly rinse the cubed potatoes with cool water in a colander to remove excess starch. Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water. Add 1 tsp of salt to the water and bring it to a boil over high heat. Boil the potatoes until they are tender (about ten minutes). Pierce the potatoes with a fork to make sure they are tender, then drain in a colander. Briefly rinse with cool water to cool the potatoes.\n2. While the potatoes are boiling, cook the eggs. Place the eggs in a small pot and cover them with cold water, then bring the pot to a boil over high heat. Let them boil for one minute before turning off the heat. Cover the pot with a lid and let the eggs sit in the hot water for 15 minutes, then carefully pour out the hot water and run cool water into the pot to stop the cooking process. Once cooled, peel and dice the eggs.\n3. While the potatoes and eggs are cooking, make the dressing. Stir together the mayonnaise, mustard, relish, red wine vinegar, Tony\u2019s (or seasoning salt), and freshly cracked pepper.\n4. Finely dice the celery, and slice the green onions.\n5. Add the cooked, cooled, and drained potatoes to a large bowl along with the diced celery, sliced green onion, diced eggs, and dressing. Stir until everything is combined and coated in the dressing. If you prefer a softer, less chunky potato salad, mash the potatoes slightly.\n6. Taste and adjust the mustard or seasoning to your liking, then serve.\n\nNOTES\n*Or your favorite seasoning salt\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIME STAMPS \n0:00 Introduction\n0:06 Peel, wash, and crop potatoes\n0:12 Boil potatoes in water with salt\n0:16 Drain and rinse potatoes\n0:20 Make dressing\n0:30 Boil eggs & dice once cooled\n0:37 Add everything to a large bowl and stir in dressing\n0:47 Serve and Enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2022-07-24T14:00:08+00:00", "duration": "PT1M", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FIJln2P1LBk/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/FIJln2P1LBk?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FIJln2P1LBk", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8", "8 1 cup each"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "recipeIngredient": ["3 lbs. Yukon Gold potatoes (1,360g, $2.98 *)", "1 tsp salt  ($0.04)", "2  eggs  (large (chilled) $0.66)", "3/4 cup mayonnaise  (6oz, $0.84)", "1 Tbsp yellow mustard  ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp sweet relish  ($0.08)", "1 Tbsp red wine vinegar  ($0.09)", "1/2 tsp Tony Chachere\u2019s seasoning ($0.03 **)", "1/4 tsp black pepper (freshly cracked, $0.04)", "2  green onions  (thinly sliced, $0.27)", "2 ribs celery (chopped (1 cup, 220g) $0.38)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Peel, wash, and chop your potatoes into one-inch cubes. It always disappears fast from pot luck tables! I've never tried Tony Chachere's with it, but used it for a seasoning--more a topping to add color instead of my usual paprika and since first reading this recipe have been using it. I like more egg--both Nana and my mom used 1 egg for every potato, but depending on the size of the potato, that varies and my rule is more like 1 egg per 12-16 oz of potato. I also use more relish or pickle juice instead of vinegar--I use Wickles for more taste, which actually doesn't really make the salad taste spicier. One reason I don't like turkey sausage is its texture; the picture makes it look like hot dog slices. Another small change I made was to use about half a cup of diced red bell pepper with the onions for some additional color. Next time I'll add diced green chiles, too. As is, it tasted darn good, was economical, and easy. I love it doesn't rely on a can of cream soup and can be easily scaled up or down! They&#39;re super easy and freezer-friendly!", "datePublished": "2021-06-12T11:26:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Lemon-Blueberry-Scones-plate.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Lemon-Blueberry-Scones-plate-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Lemon-Blueberry-Scones-plate-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/Lemon-Blueberry-Scones-plate-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Lemon Blueberry Scones", "description": "Lemon Blueberry Scones are the perfect brightly flavored baked good to go with a hot cup of coffee. They're super easy and freezer-friendly! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/lemon-blueberry-scones/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 lemon ($0.60)\n2 cups all-purpose flour ($0.19)\n2 Tbsp granulated sugar ($0.02)\n2 tsp baking powder ($0.05)\n1/2 tsp salt ($0.02)\n6 Tbsp cold butter* ($0.66)\n1/2 cup blueberries, frozen or fresh ($0.89)\n\u00bc cup milk ($0.10)\n2 large eggs ($0.47)\n1 cup powdered sugar ($0.07)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 425\u00baF. Zest and juice the lemon. You'll need about 1 tsp lemon zest for the dough and 2 Tbsp lemon juice for the glaze.\n2. Combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, and lemon zest in a large bowl. Stir until they are very well combined.\n3. Grate the butter into the flour mixture and stir until the butter is well incorporated and no large lumps remain.*\n4. Add the blueberries to the flour mixture and stir to combine (no need to thaw first, if frozen).\n5. Whisk together the milk and eggs, then pour it into the bowl with the flour and bluberries. Stir everything together until it forms a cohesive ball of dough, with no dry flour remaining on the bottom of the bowl. If the dough is too dry to come together into a single ball of dough, add a splash more milk (1 Tbsp or so) until it comes together.\n6. Press the dough out into a flat 8-inch diameter circle. Cut the circle into eight wedges. Place the cut scones on a parchment lined baking sheet.\n7. Bake the scones in the preheated 425\u00baF oven for 15-17 minutes, or until they are golden brown. Transfer the baked scones to a wire rack to cool.\n8. Allow the scones to cool completely, then combine 1 cup powdered sugar with 2 Tbsp lemon juice until it forms a thick glaze. Drizzle the glaze over the cooled scones, then enjoy!\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:07 Zest and juice a lemon\n0:12 Combine dry ingredients\n0:24 Combine eggs and milk\n0:34 Grate butter into dry ingredients\n0:37 Add frozen blueberries\n0:41 Stir in wet ingredients\n0:47 Shape and cut scone dough\n0:55 Bake then cool scones\n1:02 Make lemon glaze\n1:10 Glaze scones\n1:13 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-07-11T14:30:11+00:00", "duration": "PT1M20S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wXb-1gWr3Ao/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wXb-1gWr3Ao?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXb-1gWr3Ao", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  lemon  ($0.60)", "2 cups all-purpose flour  ($0.19)", "2 Tbsp granulated sugar  ($0.02)", "2 tsp baking powder  ($0.05)", "1/2 tsp salt  ($0.02)", "6 Tbsp cold butter (see notes, $0.66)", "1/2 cup blueberries (frozen or fresh, $0.89)", "\u00bc cup milk  ($0.10)", "2 large eggs  ($0.47)", "1 cup powdered sugar  ($0.07)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00baF. Add cold eggs to a saucepot. Add enough water to the pot to cover the eggs by one inch.\n2. Place a lid on the pot and turn the heat on to high. Allow the water to come up to a boil.\n3. Once the water reaches a full rolling boil, turn the heat off and leave the pot on the burner (with the lid on) for about 12 minutes.*\n4. After 12 minutes, transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water. Chill the eggs in the ice water for about five minutes. Peel and enjoy.\n\nNOTES\n*Cooking time may vary slightly based on your altitude, cookware, stovetop, size, and temperature of the eggs. \n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:06 Add eggs to pot\n0:10 Cover with water\n0:14 Add lid\n0:16 Turn on heat and bring to boil\n0:19 Turn off head and let rest 12 minutes\n0:24 Transfer eggs to ice bath\n0:30 Peel and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2022-01-30T19:51:09+00:00", "duration": "PT46S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ohQplA9lMV8/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/ohQplA9lMV8?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ohQplA9lMV8", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["4 large eggs"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add cold eggs to a saucepot. Enjoy with crackers, on a sandwich, or on top of a bed of greens.", "datePublished": "2021-06-03T10:55:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/12/Pesto-Chickpea-Salad-above-1.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/12/Pesto-Chickpea-Salad-above-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/12/Pesto-Chickpea-Salad-above-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/12/Pesto-Chickpea-Salad-above-1-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Pesto Chickpea Salad", "description": "This creamy and tangy Pesto Chickpea Salad is a quick and easy lunch. Enjoy with crackers, on a sandwich, or on top of a bed of greens. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/pesto-chickpea-salad/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1/4 cup mayonnaise ($0.40)\n1/4 cup basil pesto ($1.30)\n1 Tbsp lemon juice ($0.06)\n1/8 tsp freshly cracked pepper ($0.01)\n2 15oz. cans chickpeas ($1.10)\n1/4 cup red onion ($0.10)\n1/4 cup fresh parsley ($0.17)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Stir together the mayonnaise, pesto, lemon juice, and pepper in a bowl.\n2. Rinse and drain the chickpeas. Roughly chop the parsley. Finely dice the red onions (soak the red onions in cold water for 5 minutes for a milder onion flavor). Add the chickpeas, parsley, and onion to a large bowl.\n3. Pour the dressing over the chickpeas, parsley, and onion. Stir to combine. Serve as is or slightly mash the chickpeas for a thicker consistency. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Make creamy pesto dressing\n0:20 Combine chickpeas, onion, and parsley\n0:24 Add creamy pesto dressing\n0:29 Mash chickpeas\n0:31 Enjoy with crackers\n0:35 Or make a sandwich", "uploadDate": "2021-06-13T16:51:19+00:00", "duration": "PT46S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/b3gp4ZbbHTU/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/b3gp4ZbbHTU?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3gp4ZbbHTU", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 \u00be cup each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT10M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup mayonnaise ($0.40)", "1/4 cup basil pesto ($1.30)", "1 Tbsp lemon juice ($0.06)", "1/8 tsp freshly cracked pepper ($0.01)", "2 15oz. cans chickpeas ($1.10)", "1/4 cup red onion ($0.10)", "1/4 cup fresh parsley ($0.17)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir together the mayonnaise, pesto, lemon juice, and pepper in a bowl.", "name": "Stir together the mayonnaise, pesto, lemon juice, and pepper in a bowl.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pesto-chickpea-salad/#wprm-recipe-32555-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Rinse and drain the chickpeas. Tender chicken coated in a homemade sweet, savory, and tangy sauce.", "datePublished": "2025-03-17T08:30:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Sesame-Chicken-Overhead.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Sesame-Chicken-Overhead-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Sesame-Chicken-Overhead-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Sesame-Chicken-Overhead-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Easy Sesame Chicken", "description": "Faster than take out and you'll know every single ingredient used. ;) When you're short on time and you need something the whole family will love, this take-out fake-out Easy Sesame Chicken has your back. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-sesame-chicken/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\nCHICKEN\n1 large egg \n2 Tbsp cornstarch \n1 pinch each salt and pepper \n1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs \n2 Tbsp cooking oil \nSAUCE\n1/4 cup soy sauce \n2 Tbsp water \n1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil \n3 Tbsp brown sugar\n1 Tbsp rice vinegar\n1 tsp grated fresh ginger \n2 cloves garlic, minced \n1 Tbsp sesame seeds\n1/2 Tbsp cornstarch \nFOR SERVING\n4 cups cooked jasmine rice \n2 whole green onions \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. First, prepare the sauce. In a small bowl stir together the soy sauce, water, sesame oil, brown sugar, rice vinegar, fresh ginger, minced garlic, cornstarch, and sesame seeds. (Grate the ginger with a small-holed cheese grater). Set the sauce aside.\n2. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, 2 Tbsp cornstarch, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Trim any excess fat from the chicken thighs, then cut them into small 1 inch pieces. Toss the chicken in the egg and cornstarch mixture.\n3. Add the cooking oil to a large skillet and heat it over medium flame. Wait until the skillet is very hot, then swirl the skillet to make sure the oil coats the entire surface. Add the batter coated chicken and spread it out into a single layer over the surface of the skillet. \n4. Allow the chicken pieces to cook, undisturbed, until golden brown on the bottom. Then, carefully flip the chicken, breaking up the pieces into smaller clumps as you flip. Continue to cook the chicken until golden brown on the other side. Stir the chicken as little as possible to avoid breaking the egg coating from the surface of the chicken.\n5. Once the chicken is cooked through and golden brown on all sides, pour the sauce over top. Toss the chicken to coat in the sauce. As the sauce comes up to a simmer, it will begin to thicken. Continue to gently stir the chicken in the sauce until it has thickened, then turn off the heat.\n6. Serve the chicken over a bed of rice and sprinkle the sliced green onions over top.\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-07-25T21:46:50+00:00", "duration": "PT1M23S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/6hHbJQEc3ew/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/6hHbJQEc3ew?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6hHbJQEc3ew", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bc cup soy sauce ($0.20)", "2 Tbsp water ($0.00)", "1 Tbsp toasted sesame oil ($0.32)", "3 Tbsp brown sugar** ($0.30)", "1 Tbsp rice vinegar ($0.14)", "1 tsp grated fresh ginger*** ($0.10)", "2 cloves garlic, minced ($0.08)", "\u00bd Tbsp cornstarch ($0.03)", "1 Tbsp sesame seeds ($0.10)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil ($0.08)", "1 lb boneless skinless chicken thighs* ($3.48)", "1  large egg ($0.67)", "2 Tbsp cornstarch ($0.06)", "1 pinch each salt and pepper ($0.05)", "4 cups cooked jasmine rice ($0.97)", "2  whole green onions ($0.20)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, prepare the sauce. Preheat your oven to 350\u00b0F. Lightly grease a 9-inch cake pan, then line the bottom with parchment paper for easy release.", "name": "Prep", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "***To make the cake, in a medium mixing bowl, add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Using a hand mixer (or stand mixer with the paddle attachment), combine the ingredients at low speed, then set the bowl aside.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate large bowl, with the mixer on low, mix the brown sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce, and eggs until combined.", "name": "Mix", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer on low, add half of the flour blend to the large bowl and mix until just combined. Pour in the buttermilk and mix again. Finish by adding the remaining flour and mixing until everything is just incorporated, being careful not to overmix as this can make the cake dense.", "name": "Make the batter", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden and a toothpick comes out clean. Let the cake cool completely.", "name": "Bake", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the cake is baking, make the whipped cream. In a medium bowl, using a hand mixer, mix the heavy cream at high speed until it is thick and fluffy, but not stiff. Turn the hand mixer to low speed, add the powdered sugar and vanilla, and continue beating until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Then, turn the mixer to high until stiff peaks form. Set aside.", "name": "Make whipped cream", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For the pumpkin cheesecake filling, in a medium bowl, using a hand mixer on medium speed, mix the cream cheese, pure pumpkin, brown sugar, and pumpkin pie spice until soft and creamy, 2-3 minutes, then set aside.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble the trifle, cut the cooled cake into 1-inch pieces and add half of the cake pieces to the bottom of the trifle dish, covering the bottom. Then gently spread half of the pumpkin cheesecake filling evenly over the cake. Next, carefully spread half of the whipped cream evenly over the top of the pumpkin layer.", "name": "Assemble", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/pumpkin-trifle/#wprm-recipe-139533-step-0-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Repeat the process, layering the remaining cake, pumpkin cheesecake filling, then whipped cream. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/country-sausage-gravy/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 lb. pork sausage ($1.45)\n1.5 Tbsp butter ($0.16)\n2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)\n2 cups whole milk ($0.82)\n1/8 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp crushed red pepper (optional) ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp salt ($0.02)\n\n1. Add the pork sausage to a skillet and cook over medium heat, breaking it into chunks as you stir, until it is cooked through. Do not drain the fat from the skillet.\n2. Add the butter and flour to the skillet with the pork. Continue to stir and cook for about 2 minutes more.\n3. Whisk the milk into the skillet, making sure to dissolve all the browned bits off the bottom of the skillet as you whisk. Continue to stir and cook until the milk begins to simmer lightly, at which point it will thicken into a nice gravy (5 minutes).\n4. Season the gravy with red pepper, freshly cracked black pepper, garlic powder, and salt. Serve over biscuits or your favorite starchy breakfast item.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIME STAMPS \n0:00 Introduction\n0:07 Brown sausage\n0:13 Add butter and flour\n0:17 Whisk in milk\n0:20 Simmer\n0:23 Season gravy\n0:34 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2022-07-31T15:00:37+00:00", "duration": "PT43S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/utmfzEisiLk/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/utmfzEisiLk?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utmfzEisiLk", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 \u00be cup each"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 lb. pork sausage ($1.45)", "1.5 Tbsp butter ($0.16)", "2 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.02)", "2 cups whole milk ($0.82)", "1/8 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp crushed red pepper (optional) ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the pork sausage to a skillet and cook over medium heat, breaking it into chunks as you stir, until it is cooked through.
